Title: One-year Placement Programme at Hong Kong Observatory 2025
Location: Hong Kong Observatory HQ / Mira Place Tower A office / Airport Met Office
Job Description: Hong Kong Observatory is inviting applications for the 1-year Placement Programme 2025. This opportunity is open to students in your department. The placements require full-time participation covering the entire 2025 calendar year from 2 January to 31 December with a minimum duration of 8 months. Please refer to PDF and DOCX for the project details and application form respectively.
Skills & Requirements:
Applicants should
(1) be local registered full-time students of your University;
(2) be local students who are permanent residents of Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR) or non-local students who obtain a valid "No Objection Letter" from Immigration Department of HKSARG for taking up HKO internship through the University;
(3) have academic background and specific knowledge/skills for the interested projects as specified in the attachment; and
(4) be fluent in Chinese and/or English.
  Applicants should indicate their interested projects in order of priority. Please submit the completed application form with required attachments by email to train2@hko.gov.hk with subject "HKO One-Year Placement 2025" by noon of 7 October 2024 (Monday).
  Interviews will be arranged for selected candidates in late October to November 2024. Upon completion of the selection process, an agreement will be signed between the relevant department of the University and the Hong Kong Observatory. Successful candidates will work on their assigned projects for 12 months and will receive a scholarship of $11,200 per month. The full scholarship amount for the entire placement period, i.e. 12 months, will be provided to the University. The University will be responsible for disbursing the scholarship to those students who can fulfill the requirements stipulated in the agreement.
Fields of Study:
Applied Physics, Applied Science, Artifical Intelligence: Systems & Technologies, Big Data Technology, Computer & Information Sciences, Computer Science & Engineering, Computing, Computing & Software Technologies, Computing Mathematics, Data Science, Earth Sciences, Electrical / Electronic / Energy Engineering, Geography / Urban Studies, Industrial & Manufacturing Systems Engineering, Information Engineering, Mathematics / Statistics, Science, Science & Web Technology, Land Surveying & Geo-informatics, Aviation Engineering, Aerospace / Aviation Technician
...More
About Company:
Hong Kong Observatory
Training and Exercises Division
Units 2304-2309, 23/F Mira Place Tower A, 132 Nathan Road, Kowloon
Note:
Deadline for application :
Noon of 7 October 2024 (Monday) Hong Kong Local Time.
Should you have any revisions in your application, please resubmit your application with subject "Resubmit - HKO One-Year Placement 2025" before the deadline. Only the most recent record will be considered.
Should you have any enquiries, please feel free to contact us.
 train2@hko.gov.hk
 Mr Martin Tsang at 2926 8413 or Mr William Li at 2926 8318.
Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance Notification:
The personal data provided in this form will be used for the application of this placement programme only. Personal data on an unsuccessful candidate will normally be destroyed 6 months after rejection of the candidate's application. For correction of or access to personal data after submission of the application form, please contact the officers in the enquiries.

Title: Software Testing Engineer Intern
Job Description:
Join us to advance the state-of-the-art in storage security technology and serve customers all around the world.
Our team develops Bloombase StoreSafe, a fully-managed data-at-rest security software that enables customers to lock down their crown-jewel data on storage systems and services with post-quantum cryptography (PQC) technologies. We are developing new security capabilities, pushing the bounds of performance, driving distributed storage services innovation in scalability and high availability, and investing in user experience.
As a software testing engineer intern, you will collaborate with colleagues on research, prototyping, software design, and implementation. Our tech problems span all aspects of network storage technologies - NVMe, RDMA, RoCE, iWARP, Infiniband, FCP, FCoE, iSER, iSCSI, NFS, SMB, CIFS, S3, Atmos, REST, HTTP, FTP, SFTP - as well as cryptography: HSM, PKCS#11, FIPS, KMIP, AES, RSA, ECDSA, CRYSTALS-Kyber, CRYSTALS-Dilithium, FALCON, SPHINCS+, and McEliece for datacenter environments including on-premises traditional IT (SAN, NAS, DAS,CS), virtualization (VMware ESXi, VirtualBox, Hyper-V), HCI (OpenStack, Kubernetes), edge, CDI (SmartNIC, DPU, IPU) and off-premises cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP, OCI). You may choose to focus on an area, work across areas, or rotate over time. You will have the opportunity to interact with technology alliance partners and customers and to work with product managers to define product improvements. You will solve hard problems and grow your skills along the way.
If you are excited by the prospect of making it easier for customers to secure their crown-jewel data-at-rest at scale; if you are interested in OSes, cryptography, storage networking technologies, distributed systems, and/or developer tools; and if you are looking to work with teammates to propose ideas, experiment, learn, and build great software - we would love to hear from you.
JOB RESPONSIBILITY
Assist with setup of testing infrastructure
Execute and document product end user usage tests, and suggest for user experience (UX) improvements
Execute and document product unit and regression tests to ensure product meets functional specifications
Execute and document product QA tests to ensure compliance to product technical specifications
Execute and document product stress/performance tests
Execute and document product resilience tests
Execute and document product interoperability tests with datacenter, server, network cryptography and third-party storage vendor products
Help improve existing test cases and develop new test cases
Build test tools using open-source software and scripting language for test automation
Skills & Requirements:
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Any level of post-secondary (certificate, undergrad, master level, phd post-doc, etc) students with passion in computers
Skill in at least one programming languages used to build system software, e.g. Java, Kotlin, C, C++, PS
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with Linux, Microsoft Windows Server, Unix, AIX, HP-UX, OS400, zOS, macOS
Experience with Intel, AMD, Arm, MIPS, FPGA
Experience with any of the following is a plus:
Designing, building, or evolving OSes, kernel, drivers
Designing, building, or evolving network storage systems, protocols
Designing, building, or evolving cryptography systems
Designing, building, or evolving key management systems
Designing, building, or evolving developer tools
Professional certifications: CISM, CISSP, CISA
Bloombase is Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation
About Company: Bloombase is the intelligent storage firewall company providing application-transparent, high-bandwidth, low-latency data-at-rest encryption security using post-quantum cryptography (PQC) technologies from edge computing, physical and virtual datacenters, through hyper-converged infrastructure (HCI) and composable disaggregated infrastructure (CDI), and to the cloud, enabling organizations to secure their crown-jewels, mitigate data breach threats, and help meet regulatory compliance mandates.
Address: 305 Building 16W, Science Park, Hong Kong
Note: Send your cover letter, resume, past and most current transcripts, past and most current graduation certificates, reference letters only in Adobe PDF format to careers@bloombase.asia

Title: Customer Success Engineer
Job Description:
Information security is one of the hottest areas in IT. Bloombase is created with the mission to solve data leakage problems in data centers with a transformative approach.
We are building a team of coworkers with the intelligence, the skills and the drive to be the best. If you are looking for a challenging position with a well-managed, well-funded technology innovator, consider a position with Bloombase. We offer an excellent package, as well as a great place to work. We create a positive work environment that attracts and engages high-quality coworkers through a combination of excellent benefits, working conditions and company culture.
If you share the same belief and core values, we would love to talk with you! Join us to experience a Silicon Valley style work environment.
  JOB RESPONSIBILITY
To support technical aspects of a sales opportunity to the satisfaction of the sales team and customer with a view to exceeding Bloombase sales order, revenue and satisfaction targets
To understand customer requirements and related information security and protection needs
To identify and develop new opportunities for data security with our customers and influence customer in the establishment of a security strategy that favors the supply of Bloombase products and services.
To participate in face-to-face, phone or web presentations to customer, at all levels, to support the closing of sale and further enhance image of Bloombase
To ensure customer satisfaction on the technical aspects of Bloombase security solutions
Preparation of technical parts of proposals and tenders for supply of Bloombase products and services
Deliver technical input to project manager on implementation of complex technical solutions
To produce security design for all standard and non-standard data protection solutions
To deliver solution and implementation at customer sites
To explore partner resources and identify partner synergies, and work with partners to secure business cases
The post holder must have the ability to work under pressure and within tight timescales
Domestic and international travel may be necessary at short notice
Skills & Requirements:
QUALIFICATIONS
Excellent language and presentation skills
Strong customer relationship and negotiation skills to ensure one is able to present a credible image to both customers and partners building the necessary relationships at all levels to enhance our chances of success
Good business acumen with ability to understanding industry dynamics, competitive environment and business drivers
Be able to think creatively, to innovate and resolve commercial and technical problems
Ability to lead and work as a team member within virtual teams
Fluent in English, Cantonese, and Mandarin
University degree or above
Relevant technical qualification and professional certification (e.g. CISSP, CISA) a plus
Field sales engineer experience a plus
BENEFITS
Sales incentive plan (performance basis)
Medical and annual travel insurance plan
Incentive stock options plan (performance basis)
On-the-job training and 2-year fresh graduate trainee program
Exposure to top tier Global 500 scale organizations as customers
Exposure to some of the most successful IT companies and new technologies that are shaping the future of IT
Opportunities to grow with the company
Privilege to work with cool and smart people
Flexible working hours
Domestic and international business travel opportunities

Title: Technical Support Engineer
Job Description:

  JOB DESCRIPTION
Join us to advance the state-of-the-art in storage security technology and serve customers all around the world.
Our team develops Bloombase StoreSafe, a fully-managed data-at-rest security software appliance that enables customers to lock down their crown-jewel data with powerful post-quantum cryptographic technologies. We are developing new security capabilities, pushing the bounds of performance, driving distributed storage services innovation in scalability and high availability, and investing in user experience.
As a technical support engineer on the team, you will collaborate with colleagues on providing first-tier helpdesk technical support to our customers and partners worldwide over phone, email and web. Our technical problems span all aspects of network storage technologies - NVMe, RDMA, RoCE, iWARP, Infiniband, FCP, FCoE, iSCSI, NFS, SMB, CIFS, S3, Atmos, REST, HTTP, FTP, SFTP - as well as cryptography: HSM, PKCS#11, FIPS, KMIP, AES, RSA, ECC, qTESTLA, McEliece for datacenter environments including on-premises traditional IT (SAN, NAS, DAS), virtualization (VMware ESXi, VirtualBox), HCI (OpenStack, Kubernetes), edge, CDI (SmartNIC, DPU, IPU) and off-premises cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP). You will solve hard problems and grow your skills along the way.
If you are excited by the prospect of making it easier for customers to secure their crown-jewel data-at-rest at scale; if you are interested in operating systems, cryptography, storage networking technologies, distributed systems, and/or developer tools; and if you are looking to work with teammates to propose ideas, experiment, learn, and build great software - we would love to hear from you.
JOB RESPONSIBILITY
Provide first-tier helpdesk technical support to our customers and partners worldwide over phone, email and web
Roster work to support our round the clock 24/7 technical support service
Cowork with product development team for potential product bug fix(es) and enhancement(s)
The post holder must have the ability to work under pressure and within tight timescales and meet service level agreement(s)
May be required to cowork with pre-sales team for product demonstrations
May be required to cowork with product team for product testing and interoperability testing
Skills & Requirements:
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
A bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or equivalent knowledge and skills
Skill in at least one programming language used to build system software, e.g. Java, C, C++
Experience using virtual machines and cloud compute instances
Experience using high-speed network, storage fabric and services
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written
Ability to work under pressure and within tight timescales to meet service level agreement (SLA)
Ability to act individually and as a team member in resolving problems
Ability to deal with ambiguity and to execute with minimal supervision
Able to manage multiple priorities and tasks in a dynamic work environment
Self motivated team player
Strong ability to multitask
Patience and positivity
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with Linux, Microsoft Windows Server, Unix, AIX, HP-UX, OS400, zOS
Experience with Intel, AMD, Arm, MIPS, FPGA
Experience getting things done through collaboration with engineers on multiple teams, multiple timezones and multiple geographical locations
Using operating systems, kernel and driver
Using network storage systems and protocols
Using cryptography systems
Using key management systems

Title: Compliance - legal internship
Job Description:

Researching and generating legal summaries relating to concepts within the Hong Kong Securities and Futures Ordinance and Anti Money Laundering Ordinance amongst others, with the support of experienced analysts

Law students only

Law student studying in their 2nd year or above. Candidates should ideally have completed the Company Law course.
Fluent in English. Preference for candidates who are fluent in Cantonese and Mandarin.

Strong verbal communication and writing skills.
Strong work ethic.

About Company: Alpha Calibration is a compliance advisory firm providing compliance and other professional services to financial institutions in Hong Kong. Title: PMO (Project Management Office) Trainee - Enterprise CRM / ERP / HCM
Job Description:
MULTIABLE is the leading enterprise management system developer in Hong Kong with more than 6,000 corporate clients in Hong Kong, Singapore, China and other APAC regions. We are one of the very few IT firms in the region with commitment in cutting edge R&D instead of just being a reseller of foreign IT products.
Over 300 talented individuals, located among Hong Kong, Singapore, Guangzhou, Shenzhen and Shanghai, have joined us and now enjoy being part of a unique adventure. We are constantly reinforcing our team and would like to invite you to be one of us.
It is a core part of our people strategy to nurture and elevate the value of our human capital for achieving long term business success. Our HR policy is dedicated to excavating the young and high potential people to excel in project management and the IT industry and to grow with us.
A comprehensive development program including job rotation will be provided to the right candidates for securing their career path.
You will:
Handle client queries
Work closely with technical team to deliver quality solution
Monitor project progress and co-ordinate with various stakeholders for necessary resources
Perform ad-hoc duties as assigned by project management office team

**Information collected are strictly confined to recruitment purposes only.
Skills & Requirements:
You should have/be:
Degree holder in any discipline
Eager to be success in the tech industry
Experience in enterprise system (e.g. CRM, ERP, HCM etc.) or AI adoption is an advantage but not essential
A fast learner and eager to learn the essences of various industries
Self-motivated, responsible and able to work independently
Good verbal and written communication skills
Education Level (pursuing / obtained): Doctorate or above, Master / Postgraduate Diploma, Bachelor
About Company:
MULTIABLE is the leading enterprise management system developer in Hong Kong with more than 6,000 corporate clients in Hong Kong, Singapore, China and other APAC regions. Title: Financial Executive /財富規劃經理 /見習理財經理 (歡迎無相關經驗/ 本地或海外畢業生/高才通簽證)
Job Description:
Distinguish Yourself From Others

We are committed to investing in Hong Kong and, are now building a new distribution channel to market our full range of professional financial services in the territory. To cope with our business plan. We recruit professional Financial Planning Executives to strengthen our base.
  “You BELIEVE in developing a NEW & BRIGHT tomorrow”

AXA PRIME PRO

AXA Prime Pro has been launched exclusively in Hong Kong to cultivate outstanding talents. It provides full range 6 aspects support for new agents to achieve career advancement. A 24-month comprehensive professional training covering from industry knowledge, sales psychology, personal brand building and boosting business growth. All members of AXA Prime Blue will therefore possess a solid professional knowledge to become an expert on financial planning.

Our edge:

Stands out from the market, we built upon outstanding agency management system that enables successful candidates to develop and FAST TRACK their career to the unlimited height.

Core Responsibilities:
Professional Financial Services Provision to Clients, including Wealth Management & Portfolio Advices, Investment Planning, Retirement Planning, Risk Management Planning, etc.
Develop China market, provide offshore wealth management services for Putonghua speaking clients
Clients base provided
Monitor the client financial status and propose tailor-made solution to satisfy client needs
Learn Recruiting & Managing Team
Recruit HIGH Potential financial planners & build your OWN Professional TEAM
Our offer:
Basic allowance 30K-60K, Commissions and Bonus Schemes
Medical and Life Insurance, Overseas Travel Rewards, MPF and etc
Comprehensive and Professional Training Programs
Transparent and Prosperous Career Path
Subsidy to Professional certification. Eg, CFP, CFFL, RFP and etc
Skills & Requirements:
Our requirements:
Higher Diploma / Associate Degree or above of any discipline
Aggressive, outgoing and work independently
Candidates with IANG,TTPS & QMAS are welcomed.
Fresh Graduates or New in this industry will also be considered
Education Level (pursuing / obtained): Bachelor, Higher Diploma / Associate Degree, Master / Postgraduate Diploma, Doctorate or above
About Company:
We are agency force of AXA China Region Insurance Company Limited.
AXA provides facilities and packages for us to develop our business. (eg. financially, training....etc.)
Address: SUITE 3901, 39/F, AXA TOWER, LANDMARK EAST, 100 HOW MING STREET, KWUN TONG
Job Categories:
Banking and Finance Executive
Management Trainee
Sales / Account Servicing / Business Development

Title: HR and Admin Intern
Job Description:
Performing HR functions include job posting, arranging interviews, prepare interview notes, assessments.
Preparing general HR / Admin reports.
Assist in updating in HR policies, rules and guidelines.
Assist in updating recruitment, HR and IT related control lists.
Assist in perfecting the HR filing system for easy access.
Support the onboarding / offboarding process of interns and employees, ensuring a smooth and positive experience for them.
Assist in improving the basic skills training programme for interns.
Conduct analysis of past recruitment effort to enhance talent acquisition.
Perform ad hoc duties as assigned.
Skills & Requirements:
Full time university student (Year 2 or above) with strong academic record (GPA 3.4 or above) in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related discipline
Basic knowledge in Employment Ordinance
Excellent word processing skills (Word, Excel, Outlook & PPT required)
Possess a high level of initiative and integrity with positive working attitude.
Capable of working independently, responsible and discreet
Meticulous, well-organized, detail-oriented and willing to learn.
Able to work under pressure and meet tight deadline.
Good interpersonal, communication, co-ordination and problem solving skills.
Good command of spoken and written English and Cantonese.
Fields of Study: Accounting & Finance, Human Resources & Labour Relations
About Company: Established in 2002, Cheetah Investment Management Limited is a licensed corporation under the SFO engaging in Types 1, 4 and 9 Regulated Activities.   It belongs to Cheetah Group Holdings Limited, a specialist hedge and alternative funds investment company – seeding, investing and partnering with funds with assets exceeding US$1B.  The principals of Cheetah have a combined investment experience of over 50 years.
Address: Units 3702-03, 37th Floor, Dah Sing Financial Centre, 248 Queen's Road East, Wanchai, Hong Kong
Note: Full time or Off cycle applicants only.
Job Categories:
Human Resources / Training / Recruitment
Administration - Private Sector

Title: Fund Administration and Operations Intern
Job Description:
Provide administrative and operational support to fund operations / administration and accounting department.
Assist in updating supporting schedules for business operations.
Assist in fund audit workflow and organisation of email server and file server.
Assist in fund expenses analysis.
Assist in updating various lists and logs including payment instructions log, corporate actions, staff trading, fund subscription & redemptions logs. 
Assist in calculating investor returns.
Ad hoc projects as assigned.
Skills & Requirements:
Full time university student (Year 3 or above) with GPA 3.4 or above in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Quantitative Finance, Business Administration.
Strong desire to develop a long-term career in asset management industry.
Strong self-motivation and drive to achieve excellence.
Ability to be flexible, forward thinking and show initiative while working in a challenging and fast paced environment.
Intermediate Excel skills or equivalent.
Good interpersonal, communication and problem solving skills.
Capable of serving as a role model for displaying openness, teamwork and integrity.
Permanent residents of Hong Kong or holding a valid Hong Kong work visa.
To be successful in this role, the candidate needs to be a motivated and self-driven individual eager to contribute to the growth of the organization.
About Company: Established in 2002, Cheetah Investment Management Limited is a licensed corporation under the SFO engaging in Types 1, 4 and 9 Regulated Activities.  It belongs to Cheetah Group Holdings Limited, a specialist hedge and alternative funds investment company – seeding, investing, and partnering with funds with assets exceeding US$1B.  The principals of Cheetah have a combined investment experience of over 50 years.
Address: Units 3702-03, 37th Floor, Dah Sing Financial Centre 248 Queen's Road East Wanchai Hong Kong

Title: Equity Research Intern - CONSUMER
Company: Daiwa Capital Markets Hong Kong Limited
Job Description:
To provide research assistant support to analysts.
To help write well thought-out institutional-level investment reports.
To support on updating comprehensive financial models and databases.
To research and gather data to support investment theses.
To help with any other client requests.
Skills & Requirements:
Students from reputable universities, with a demonstrated passion in finance and investments, preferably with a major in Accounting or Finance.
Must have good spoken and written English. Ability to read and communicate in Chinese (Mandarin) is a big positive.
Ability to think independently and pitch investment ideas convincingly.
Strong work ethic and a “can do” attitude. Willing to go above and beyond what it takes to complete a task.
Have a clear passion for finance and the stock markets.
Able to work for 3 to 6 months (at least till year-end), at least 3 days a week.
About Company: Daiwa Capital Markets Hong Kong Limited, which has been operating in Hong Kong since 1970, is regulated by Securities & Futures Commission. We provide regional coverage to an established international client base, maximizing client opportunities through the utilization of the resources and network of Daiwa Securities Group Inc.

Address: Level 28, One Pacific Place, 88 Queensway, Hong Kong

Title: Student Intern (Energy Community Project)
Job Description:
About our impactful project:
“Smart Low-Carbon Energy Community” is a people-centered and community-based research project. The research team led by the Department of Geography and Asian Energy Studies Centre of Hong Kong Baptist University are collaborating with experts from seven universities in Asia to combine expertise in smart energy saving, solar power, big data, community participation, and low-carbon energy policy. Our team will jointly build four smart low-carbon energy communities with local residents between 2021 and 2024, and we will further extend the project to other global cities in the future.
As a Student Intern of our Smart Low-carbon Communities Project, you will coordinate the establishment of four smart low-carbon energy community networks and perform other job duties as shown below. You can even use solar power with the communities and participate in low-carbon community activities. We invite you to imagine, design and practise how to make good use of “energy”, a valuable community resource, to save money, reduce carbon emissions, and promote community inclusiveness and sustainable development in Hong Kong.
Job duties: (**Flexible choice(s) from the below Teams**)
Team A (Data Management)
Team B (Community Activity Assistance)
Team C (Technical Support)
Team D (Administration)
Team E (Media Creators)
Duration: 
Sep 2024 to Jan 2025 (with Flexible working hours) 
Weekend duties may be available (optional) 
For students who choose to follow the stream of UGRP, an allowance of $8,000 will be provided for programme completion 
 Benefits: 
Free Training Programme 
Acquire practical skills (community engagement, ArcGISmap) 
Bring social impacts by helping building sustainable city 
Broaden international horizon 
Train teamwork skills 
Allowance package
Skills & Requirements:
Job requirements:
● Full-time undergraduate with a major preferably in geography, energy studies, environmental studies, or related social science disciplines from a local recognised education institution
● Have an outgoing personality and passionate in communicating with community
● Committed to learning more about energy and environmental issues
● Good command of written and spoken English and Chinese (including fluency in Cantonese) is essential
● Strong communication and interpersonal skills are essential
● Students should be self-motivated, responsive, conscientious, able to work independently and under pressure
Fields of Study: Social Sciences, Sustainability, Communication, Science, Business Administration
About Company: The Asian Energy Studies Centre (AESC) (renamed in September 2014; previously the Hong Kong Energy Studies Centre) is a university-supported Category-II research centre based in the Faculty of Social Sciences at Hong Kong Baptist University. The AESC aims to be an internationally recognised hub for sustainable energy studies on the Asian region. We are committed to pursuing excellence in academic research in the areas of sustainable energy, with particular focus from the perspectives of governance in the Asian context. We promote informed energy decision-making and improve energy policies in this region, including Hong Kong, by creating new knowledge, providing practical policy recommendations, promoting knowledge exchange, and facilitating stakeholder engagement. We undertake interdisciplinary collaborative research projects, organize academic workshops, public seminars and other engagement events.
Application Methods: Please address your application to : Karen Mak, Research Assistant, Asian Energy Studies Centre
Address: Room 1202, 12/F, Academic and Administration Building, 15 Baptist University Road, Kowloon Tong, Hong Kong
Note:
Documents required:
1. CV (For year 1 student, you may submit DSE result)
2. a photo of yourself (not larger than 10MB) (Optional)
3. Transcript(s) (unofficial)
4. 150-200 words to elaborate why you would like to join the AESC Internship Programme.
5. Other supporting document(s), such as cover letter, reference letter, achievements, etc
Job Categories:
Community / Social Worker
Environment / Sustainability
Research Assistant / Technicians

About Company:
Sing Tao News Corporation Limited is a media corporation with a vision to become a leading content and service provider serving global Chinese communities. Its principal activities comprise Media and Media-related operations including Newspapers, Magazines, Recruitment Media, Books and Content Services. The Company is listed on the Main Board of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (stock code: 1105).
The "Sing Tao" brand dates back to 1938 when the daily newspaper of the same title was launched in Hong Kong. Over the years, "Sing Tao" has become recognised as a global name in the print media market. Leveraging on the strength of the brand, the Group's business has extended to a comprehensive portfolio ranging from free newspapers to magazines and electronic media. Based in Hong Kong and with a business network covering major cities of the PRC, the US, Canada and Europe, the Group employs around 1,250 staff worldwide.

Title: Valuer - 2024 Graduate Position
Job Description:
Service: Surveying / Property Valuation Advisory
Location: Hong Kong
Scope:
We are looking for fresh graduates to join our expanding property valuation team of our Hong Kong office. Our valuers will have the opportunities to have a wide range of exposure to various industries of our listed and unlisted clients for different valuation needs. Our property valuation services include:
Performing valuations for various purposes, including M&A transactions, financial reporting, HKEx listing rules compliance, tax planning and internal reference.
Advising companies and stakeholders in relation to valuation related matters
Meeting top management from listed companies and privately-held clients
Job Description and Responsibilities:
Valuers will work as a team in general, with our partner, managers and other senior valuers. You are expected to:
Assist in conducting property valuation, feasibility studies and other advisory related projects for listed and private entities
Conduct data collection and market research to support our advice and opinions provided to clients
Prepare valuation model and report
Assist in preparing proposals and presentation materials for potential valuation and consulting leads
Work closely with our professional team members including MHKIS, MRICS, CFA & CPA
Skills & Requirements:
University graduates in Real Estate, Surveying, Property Management, Business or related disciplines
Proficiency in both written and spoken English, Cantonese and Mandarin
Fluent in Mandarin will be a plus
Good team player and attention to details
Business trip to PRC and overseas may be required
Benefit: We offer attractive remuneration package including a 5-day work week, medical insurance and good career prospect to the suitable candidate.
Fields of Study: Building Surveying & Construction Management, Hotel & Tourism Management, Real Estate, Business Administration
About Company:
AVISTA Valuation Advisory Limited/ AVISTA PRO WIS Risk Advisory Limited/ AVA Intelligent Partners Limited
Member of AVISTA Group
AVISTA Group is founded by a group of enthusiastic valuation, accounting, and finance professionals. We are specialized to provide a full range of valuation, risk management advisory, corporate advisory and property consultancy services to address the various needs of our corporate clients.
Address: Suites 2401-06, 24/F, Everbright Centre, No 108 Gloucester Road, Wan Chai, Hong Kong

About Company:
香港青年協會（簡稱青協）於1960年成立，是香港最具規模的非牟利青年服務機構。主要宗旨是為青少年提供專業而多元化的服務及活動，使青少年在德、智、體、群、美等各方面獲得均衡發展；其經費主要來自政府津貼、公益金撥款、賽馬會捐助、信託基金、活動收費、企業及個人捐獻等。
青協設有會員制度與各項專業服務，為全港青年及家庭提供支援及有益身心的活動。轄下超過80個服務單位，每年提供超過25,000項活動，參與人次接近600。青協服務以青年為本，致力拓展下列12項「核心服務」，以回應青少年不斷轉變的需要；同時亦透過「青協 會員易」(easymember.hk)平台及青協手機應用程式，全面聯繫逾45萬名登記會員。
Address: 21/F, The Hong Kong Federation of Youth Groups Building 21 Pak Fuk Road, North Point, Hong Kong
Note: 求職者可於erecruit.hkfyg.org.hk遞交網上申請；或於erecruit.hkfyg.org.hk/ApplicationForm.doc下載申請表格, 填妥後電郵 (recruit@hkfyg.org.hk) 香港青年協會；或將履歷表及要求待遇經Jijis “Apply Now”網上申請。

Title: Development Officer/ Assistant Development Officer (Lodge & Adventure Programme Management) (香港青年協會領袖學院)
Company: The Hong Kong Federation of Youth Groups - Head Office
Fields of Study: Sports Science, Communication, Languages / Linguistics, Education, Business Administration, Others
About Company:
The Hong Kong Federation of Youth Groups (HKFYG) is the city's largest youth service organisation. Since its establishment in 1960, the HKFYG has been providing opportunities and facilities for the social, educational, cultural and physical development of young people. Income is obtained primarily from government subvention, as well as grants from the Community Chest of Hong Kong, the Hong Kong Jockey Club Charities Trust, other trust funds, programme fees, and both private and corporate donations.
The HKFYG, through its youth membership network, provides quality services that address the issues and concerns of young people and promotes healthy all-round development. Over 70 service units organise more than 20,000 activities annually, with attendance to the various programmes now standing at five million a year. Over 450,000 registered members are engaged through the online platform, easymember.hk and the HKFYG app.
Address: 21/F, The Hong Kong Federation of Youth Groups Building 21 Pak Fuk Road, North Point, Hong Kong
Note: To apply, please submit an online application at HKFYG Recruitment Portal erecruit.hkfyg.org.hk OR complete the application form (downloaded from erecruit.hkfyg.org.hk/ApplicationForm.doc) and email to recruit@hkfyg.org.hk OR click “Apply Now” via Jijis.

Title: Graphic Design Assistant, M+ Museum
Fields of Study: Graphic & Commercial Arts, Fine Arts, Design, Arts
About Company:
M+ is a museum dedicated to collecting, exhibiting, and interpreting visual art, design and architecture, moving image, and Hong Kong visual culture of the twentieth and twenty-first centuries. In Hong Kong’s West Kowloon Cultural District, we are building one of the largest museums of modern and contemporary visual culture in the world, with a bold ambition to establish ourselves as one of the world’s leading cultural institutions. Our aim is to create a new kind of museum that reflects our unique time and place, a museum that builds on Hong Kong’s historic balance of the local and international to define a distinctive and innovative voice for Asia’s twenty-first century.
  (This is a fixed-term contract position of 6-month with possibility for renewal subject to organisational needs and individual performance.)
Address: WKCDA Tower, West Kowloon Cultural District, No. 8 Austin Road West, Kowloon, Hong Kong

Title: SEN Learning Support Instructor Trainee (English / Chinese) (Full time) (特殊需要學習支援導師 中/英)
Job Description:
~ Work with children with Special Educational Needs, mainly with dyslexia.
~ Teach systematic learning strategies for learning support programs of primary to secondary school level (Chinese/English).
~ Work either at the Boaz Centre and/or schools
~ Need to travel between Hong Kong and Macau
~ Work for 44 hours Monday to Saturday
Skills & Requirements:
~ Having 1 year of teaching experience and / or special education experience is an advantage.
~ An interest in building a career in the field of SEN Education.
~ Proficiency in written English and Chinese, and spoken fluent English and Chinese (Cantonese ).
~ HKDSE result must obtain level 4 or above or the equivalent.
~Graduated with a Bachelor's degree or above majoring in either Chinese language, English language, Linguistics, Education, Special Education, Psychology, or related subjects.
~ Responsible, self-motivated, accountable, empathy, critical and analytic thinking, good listening and questioning, conflict management, good communication skills, patience, multi-tasking.
About Company:
The founder of Boaz International Education Institute, Ms. Twiggy Chan, suffers from dyslexia, in which her own experience makes her understand the hardships for the students and parents in the learning journey of learning with Special Education Needs (SEN). In 2013, she founded Boaz International Education Institute specialize in serving students with SEN.
Boaz believes that "If the children do not learn the way we teach, we teach the way they learn".  Boaz is committed to make use of students' strengths, such as visionary and kinaesthetic skills, to provide students with a set of appropriate learning strategies, so that they can become independent learners.
Since Boaz was established, Boaz has collaborated with more than 100 schools and institutions, bringing hope to more than 800 students and families. Over 95% of the students were able to use the spelling strategy during their first session in Boaz, where they succeeded in spelling a new and complicated English word; in six months, they could successfully write a paragraph. Boaz is now well-recognized and has received numerous awards, including the "DBS Corporate Development Fund Winner", "HSBC Youth Entrepreneurship Award" Gold Award, "Top Ten SMEs Excellent Customer Service Award", "Creative Entrepreneurship Award" issued by the City Youth Chamber of Commerce ” and "We like HK Best Corporate Responsibility Award" etc.
On top of teaching-learning strategies, Boaz Education and a group of enthusiastic learning support instructors are also committed to developing children's potential. Boaz also provides various courses for students to explore themselves and understand the community, and we are committed to educating the public and parents to make them believe in each and every child. All students have their unique talents which can make them shine in society.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g2d4EYkKQ00
Address: Room 803, 8/F, Sunbeam Commercial Building, 469-471 Nathan Road, Yaumatei, Kowloon
Note: For interested candidates, please send your full resume by email to hr@boazeducation.com.hk  on or before 3/10/2024 2024. Please state the job title in the subject of your email.

Title: Customer Services Assistant (The Racing Club)
Location: Happy Valley Racecourse and Sha Tin Racecourse (*Actual working location would depends on the event.)
Job Description:
The Job
You will
Assist The Racing Club Engagement Team to execute Members’ events during racedays and non-racedays e.g. greet Members and their guests, taking photos and attendance, distributing souvenirs etc.
Work closely under instructions from The Racing Club Engagement Team to ensure a smooth flow of events and minimise error
Work for non-office working hours and Public Holidays at both Happy Valley and Sha Tin Racecourses. Working hours will be notified per job
Design e-posters for catering promotions
Skills & Requirements:
About You
You should have
Qualification of Hong Kong Diploma of Secondary Education (HKDSE) Examination or above with 5 subjects passed
Relevant working experience in Customer Service would be an advantage
Proficiency in using Illustrator and Photoshop
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills in both English and Cantonese. Mandarin is a plus.
Responsible, punctual and able to work independently
An out-going personality and high team spirit to work with others effectively
Be customer-centric, self-motivated and attention to details and logistics
A professional manner on handling confidential information
About Company:
Founded in 1884, The Hong Kong Jockey Club is a world-class racing club that acts continuously for the betterment of our society.
The Club has a unique integrated business model, comprising racing and racecourse entertainment, a membership club, responsible sports wagering and lottery, and charities and community contribution. Through this model, the Club generates economic and social value for the community and supports the Government in combatting illegal gambling. In 2021/22, the Club returned a total of HK$33.6 billion to the community. This included HK$27.0 billion to the Government in duty, profits tax and Lotteries Fund contributions and HK$6.6 billion in approved charity donations.
The Club is Hong Kong's largest single taxpayer and one of the city's major employers. Its Charities Trust is also one of the world's top ten charity donors. The Club is always "riding high together for a better future" with the people of Hong Kong.
Address: 4/F, The Hong Kong Jockey Club Headquarters, One Sports Road, Happy Valley
Note:
The Department
The Racing Club is the young elite Member Segment in the Hong Kong Jockey Club. It uncovers a unique way to savour racing and to explore the sport like never before. Its mission is to take the passion for horse racing to the next level through an endless stream of exclusive, tailor-made experiences. The candidate is responsible for assisting at various members’ events to contribute premium and dedicated customer communication and services to enhance customer satisfaction and loyalty to The Racing Club.
  Working Schedule: Racedays and Non-Racedays (4-6 hours per day / 6-7 days per month)  
*Actual working hours would depend on operational needs.

Title: Facilitator/ 中小學活動導師
Company: GESTALT WHOLE PERSON DEVELOPMENT CO. LIMITED
Job Description:
本公司為各間中小學舉辦生涯規劃活動，透過桌上遊戲或不同活動灌輸相關概念。現招募活動導師，工作內容如下：
帶領小組中的學生參與桌上遊戲或其他活動
活動之前需出席公司就活動進行的講解及訓練，熟悉桌上遊戲及相關活動的玩法
遊戲過程中，引導學生思考生涯規劃
Skills & Requirements:
開朗、對學生有耐性
健談、具備良好溝通能力
就讀教育、社工、心理、輔導等學科者，可獲優先考慮
有興趣申請的同學，請email CV到info@gestaltwpd.com，我們會有專人跟進
Education Level (pursuing / obtained): Higher Diploma / Associate Degree, Master / Postgraduate Diploma, Doctorate or above, Bachelor
About Company:
格式塔心理學派由三名德國心理學家Wertheimer、Kohler及Koffka於二十世紀初期創立，當中提倡生物的認知建基於整體的完形，而非由個別要素的簡單聯合，其基本原 則是「整體大於其構件之總和」(“the whole is more than the sum of its parts”)。受格式塔心理學派所啟發，我們將概念套用於人的學習領域:個人發展不僅限於學術訓練 及品德培育，亦包含領導才能、團隊精神、認識自我和情緒管理、解難能力、社交溝 通等多元要素。我們深信全面學習的效能大於各項個別學習項目的效能總和(“the whole is more than the sum of its parts”)，有助達致全人發展。
我們的跨界別團隊由各行業的專業人士組成，包括:大學學者、中小學教師、註冊社工、輔導員、企業家、專業護士等。在不同思維及背景的交匯下，我們凝聚相關知識與技能，為社會提供各種種類的多元培訓服務。
Address: B1 12/F Kailey Industrial Center 12 Fung Yip Street Chai Wan, Hong Kong
Note:
活動並非定期舉行，實際日期及時間按學校需要而定
活動在不同中小學舉行，因此工作地點遍及各區
有興趣申請的同學，請email CV到info@gestaltwpd.com，我們會有專人跟進

Title: Project Officer in Institute of Special Needs and Inclusive Education (Ref: 2400848)
Company: The Education University of Hong Kong
Job Description:
Project Officer (Ref: 2400848)
Institute of Special Needs and Inclusive Education 
Project Title: Inclusive Employment Programme for Persons with Disabilities
The Institute of Special Needs and Inclusive Education on (ISNIE) is seeking a highly motivated and dedicated person to support the project planning and administration in the area of special education. The appointee will be responsible for providing administrative support to administrative support to education-related projects, academic programme, and daily programme operations of the Institute.  Other duties include providing secretarial support to project and meetings; writing reports and proposals; liaising with programme personnel, students and external bodies; carrying out general administrative duties such as arranging meetings/events/visits/academic activities, system work and office management; and performing. The initial appointment will be for a period of 24 months.
Skills & Requirements:
Applicants should have a Bachelor’s degree with several years of post-qualification working experience.  He/she should also have good knowledge in computer applications, proficiency in both spoken and written English and Chinese.  He/she should be self-motivated and be able to work independently as well as in a team.  
Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.
Initial appointment will be made on a fixed-term contract.  Fringe benefits include the University’s Voluntary Contributions to MPF Scheme or a contract-end lump sum payment (totaling up to 10% of the basic salary), leave, medical and dental benefits.
The University only accepts and considers applications submitted online for this post.  Applicants should complete the online application form and upload a full CV on or before 19 September 2024. Applications which are incomplete or without the required documents may not be considered.  Personal data provided by applicants will be used for recruitment and other employment-related purposes.  For details of the Personal Information Collection Statement, please refer to http://www.eduhk.hk/jobsopp/index.php?glang=en.
All applications will be treated in strict confidence.  Only those who are shortlisted will be contacted.  The University reserves the right not to fill the position(s) advertised.  
Further information about the University is available at http://www.eduhk.hk. 
EdUHK is an Equal Opportunities Employer.
About Company: Further information about the University is available at http://www.eduhk.hk.

Title: Pre-sales Engineer
Job Description:
We are looking for talents who loves to create meaningful solutions to help people & organization to achieve their goals.
Since 2001, we have launched our internship program for 2 purposes:
Students have opportunity to better understand the real-world technologies and skills might need in future life.
Offer a testing field for student to discover their passion and capability for future career
The internship in teaching & learning and internal practice & assessment method. You are free to decide what kind of topic/technology/solution/rule… for your internship.
Responsibilities:
Pre-Sales support on product and solution consultation services.
Meet customer to gather user requirement.
Work with technical team to fulfill customer’s needs.
Evaluate new solutions, and keep updated with latest IT trends.
Responsible for solution and tender proposal preparation & proof-of concept/demonstration.
Study latest IT solutions and represent vendors to the market.
Train and support partners to sell and provide system integration services on networking, cloud, etc.
Partner product and technical enablement.
Provide consultation services to channel partners for solution design.
Skills & Requirements:
Technical Skills:
Diploma / Degree holder in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject.
An ability to communicate technical information to non-technical staff in a way that is easy to understand.
Sound communication and presentation skill.
Other:
Working closely with the sales team on proposals and pitches for business.
Attending meetings with business development managers and acting as a technical expert.
Putting together business cases for the sales teams to support their proposals.
Working closely and collaboratively with customers to devise effective solutions.
Ensuring that the company’s product can deliver on the customer’s requirements.
Working closely with customers to understand and capture requirements.
Replying to customers following requests for information and proposal requests.
Presenting proposals to customers alongside members of the sales team.
Assist Business Development Manager to prepare detailed costings for customers and ensuring the contract is profitable.
Assist business development manager to collaborate with service, engineering, and technical support resources to ensure proposed deals include technical solutions that accurately address customer needs, and are appropriately supported by key customer technical decision-makers.
Fresh grad. are also welcome.

Title: 2024 Engineering Winter Internship Programme
Job Description:
Role Introduction
Have you planned what to do during your semester break? Have you ever been curious about how an aircraft engineer supports a world-class airline to manage one of the most sophisticated fleets in the world? Apply to our Engineering Winter Internship Programme today!
Our 9-week full time internship programme offers you an unparalleled chance to get your hands on the heart of Cathay’s technical operations and help get your Engineering career off to a flying start.
Key Responsibilities
What you'll experience
You will be attached to one of our elite engineering teams and given a real-life engineering problem to own and solve. Through visits, briefings and on-the-job training, you will understand what it takes to deliver a safe, compliant and reliable fleet that moves people forward in life by connecting them with meaningful people, places and experiences.
You will also have the opportunity to work alongside and learn from the best experts in the field of fleet management and meet other passionate budding Engineers like yourself - some of whom may even become your future colleagues!
Skills & Requirements:
Requirements
What are we looking for?
Year 2 or above undergraduates from any discipline (Engineering degree would be an advantage)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent interpersonal skills and collaboration mindset
Creative and innovative mind-set
Passionate in aviation engineering industry
Excellent command of written and spoken English
Right of abode in Hong Kong (Non-local students with a “No Objection Letter “ are welcome)
Available to work full-time from 16 December 2024 to 7 February 2025
About Company:
Personal & Application Information
Cathay Pacific is an Equal Opportunities Employer. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with our personal data policy and for recruitment purposes only. Candidates not notified within eight weeks may consider their application unsuccessful. All related information will be kept in our file for up to 24 months. A copy of our Personal Information Collection Statement will be provided upon request by contacting our Data Protection Officer.
Job Categories: Engineering - Electronic / Industrial / Electrical / Mechanical and others

About Company:
Jack & Jill Treehouse - http://www.jacknjill.com.hk/
Jack & Jill Treehouse is a fast-expanding registered language learning centre with over 20 years of experience in Hong Kong and 10 years in Shanghai. We are renowned for offering creative and activity language courses to children and bespoke one-to-one classes from kindergarten to secondary school. We provide authentic English learning atmosphere and environment conducive to the intellectual, physical, social and emotional development of students.

Located in Midlevels and TaiKoo, our young learners are mainly from the international school system and from top local schools.

We provide a diverse range of English language lessons, from playgroup to liberal studies. Our philosophy is to use an interactive, flexible approach to teach our students through creative and active learning. Our small classes aim to provide a comfortable and inspirational setting for language learning. Young Writer, our most popular course, encourages children to write unique and imaginative stories through vivid descriptions and vocabulary.

We are a dynamic team of young, energetic and professional teachers who support one another in all aspects, from lesson planning to curriculum development.

Title: Wing Chun Kung Fu Instructor
Job Description:
Position Overview:
We are offering a unique and enriching Apprenticeship in Wing Chun Kung Fu, ideal for individuals dedicated to mastering this martial art and developing into influential instructors. This apprenticeship will provide extensive training and support, equipping you with the skills necessary to become a key part of our teaching team. Upon successful completion and meeting the apprenticeship requirements, you will be offered a contract for a part-time or full-time instructor position.
Key Responsibilities:
Assist lead instructors in delivering Wing Chun classes for all ages, from kids to adults.
Engage deeply with the practice and philosophy of Wing Chun, focusing on mind-body integration.
Participate in ongoing training sessions and development workshops.
Support students in achieving personal and community goals.
Contribute to school events, demonstrations, and the nurturing of our family-oriented community.
 Benefits:
Comprehensive apprenticeship training under the guidance of seasoned martial arts professionals.
Upon successful completion of the apprenticeship, an opportunity to transition into a part-time or full-time instructor role, with a minimum contract commitment of two years.
Become part of a vibrant community dedicated to preserving Chinese culture and Wing Chun traditions.
Access to all school facilities and discounted workshops.
A supportive environment that emphasizes continuous personal and professional growth.
  How to Apply:
Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume and a brief cover letter expressing their interest in martial arts and teaching. Applications should be sent to info@mindfulwingchun.com.hk (WhatsApp for any questions:  66207050)
Embark on a transformative journey through this Apprenticeship—embrace a lifestyle of growth, community, and tradition. We look forward to welcoming you into our family!
Skills & Requirements:
Required Skills and Qualifications:
Passion for physical and mental well-being.
Enthusiasm for self-development and helping others achieve their potential.
Preferably some experience in Kung Fu or other martial arts, though not mandatory.
A relatively good fitness level and physical coordination.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Fields of Study: Communication, Creative Arts and Culture, Education, Health Professions, Sports Science
Education Level (pursuing / obtained): Doctorate or above, Master / Postgraduate Diploma, Bachelor, Higher Diploma / Associate Degree
About Company:
About Us:
Established in 2008 in the heart of Hong Kong, Mindful Wing Chun is the largest full-time Kung Fu school in the region. We've proudly showcased our art and dedication on numerous local and international TV channels, including TVB and CCTV.
Our legacy is deeply rooted in tradition, as our teacher was Ip Man's third student, preserving an authentic and genuine method of Wing Chun. We are passionate about not only teaching self-defense but also fostering a strong mind-body connection, leading to stress relief, mental calmness, postural alignment, and efficient movement.
Although our school derives from the lineage of the famous Grandmaster Ip Man, our training and teaching methods are quite different from those of other schools.
Now we teach in various locations all over Hong Kong from our HQ in Central to International Schools and Clubhouses!
Application Methods: Please address your application to : Tom, Operations Manager, MWC
Address: 11-15 On Lan Street 8/F On Lan Centre Central
Note: - Must have the right to live and work in Hong Kong without sponsorship

ActusRayPartners is a fast-growing emerging asset management company based in Hong Kong.  Founded in 2019, the investment manager applies a Discretionary Probabilistic Investing process to alternative strategies.  The investment process is built upon a quantitative framework on which the company overlays a discretionary strategy across hundreds of positions.  We have a collaboration agreement with Sun Hung Kai & Co. Limited (SEHK:86), a listed financial services company. ActusRayPartners aims for the best in terms of consistent risk-adjusted performance, operations and client communications. 
  With the growth of the business and an array of opportunities ahead for a potential candidate, ActusRayPartners is looking for a Winter Intern to join the Research, Development and Implementation (RDI) team. The team covers a wide range of roles and responsibilities ranging from quantitative research and data management to coding, development and support of IT infrastructure for the company as a whole.

Title: Qualified and Experienced English Language Lecturers or above
Company: Beijing Normal University–Hong Kong Baptist University United International College (Translated Name)
About Company: Located in the beautiful coastal city of Zhuhai, Beijing Normal University-Hong Kong Baptist University United International College (UIC) is the first full-scale cooperation in higher education between the Chinese mainland and Hong Kong, jointly founded by Beijing Normal University (BNU) and Hong Kong Baptist University (HKBU). Since its first student enrolment in 2005, with the aim of serving China and the world, UIC has built a new model for liberal arts education in China by tapping into traditional Chinese and Western cultural resources. The college has established the Faculty of Business and Management, School of Culture and Creativity, Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences, Faculty of Science and Technology, and School of General Education, in addition to the Graduate School. Altogether UIC offers over 9,000 students around 30 undergraduate programmes in 13 departments as well as research and taught postgraduate programmes. For more information about UIC, please click on https://uic.edu.cn/en/.
Address: 2000 Jintong Road,Tangjiawan, Zhuhai, Guangdong Province, P.R.China

Job Description:

Assist with experimental planning, concept validation and execution of wet lab.
Assist with preparing and analyzing samples.

Maintain daily operation of laboratory, such as procurement, inventory check, calibration and maintenance of equipment.

Requirements
BSc or above in Biology, Biochemistry, Biotechnology, Cell Biology, Molecular Biology, Microbiology, Biomedical Engineering or any other related discipline
Fresh graduate is welcome.
Experience in general laboratory work
Good written and spoken Chinese and English
Familiar with medical device regulatory requirements
Foresight and innovative ability
Strong organization, planning and work coordination skills
Meticulous and with excellent interpersonal and communication skills with all levels of staff
Responsible, independent, detail minded and can work under pressure

About Company:
About Opharmic
Founded in 2016, Opharmic is striving towards an ambitious goal: to replace horrifying eye injections around the world with our patented non-invasive ultrasound system. From technology and product customisation, to clinical development and regulatory strategies, Opharmic offers turnkey solution to pharma partners around the world to adopt cutting-edge technology in their new or existing pipelines.

Title: Electrical Engineer
Job Description:

Participate in the research, design, development, and integration of new ultrasound systems.
Coordinate projects and tasks with other colleague to complete assignments and projects on schedule.
Research and investigate leading edge technologies for creating new products or processes.
Support new product development project while adhering to quality control and regulatory procedures.
Facilitate the translation from conceptual testing to prototyping and manufacturing.

Requirements
Bachelor of Science or equivalent experience in Electrical Engineering, electrical and electronic Engineering, or a relevant engineering or physical science discipline.
At least 2 years minimum experience in the field of electronics or signal processing field.
Demonstrated experience with PCB design for electrical appliances for rapid prototyping activities and further development process.
Knowledge in ultrasound electrical appliances PCB design is a bonus
Familiarity with signal collection, signal processing techniques and signal-to-noise ratio analysis.
Experience in MATLAB or any related software for signal processing and development.
Capability to work in a fast paced, regulated environment, with strict adherence to a quality system.
Hands-on experience in bring-up, debug, and testing of sensing systems using laboratory equipment such as oscilloscopes and spectrum/network analysers.
Good written and oral communication skills.
Good interpersonal skills and an ability to work with every level of the organization.
Foresight and innovative ability.
Strong organization, planning and work coordination skills.
Meticulous and with excellent interpersonal and communication skills with all levels of staff.
Responsible, independent, detail minded and can work under pressure.

Biomedical Engineering, Electrical / Electronic / Energy Engineering, Engineering, Industrial & Manufacturing Systems Engineering, Systems Engineering & Engineering Management, Product Analysis & Engineering Design, Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science & Engineering, Physical Sciences
...More

Job Description:

Responsible for providing sales support to the team, includes preparing sales quotations, invoices, packing lists, and other order records.

Conduct market research to identify and pursue new business opportunities by proactively prospecting target markets, developing sales strategies, and executing sales plans.

1-2 years clerical working experience is preferred but fresh graduates are also welcome
Experience in a manufacturing company will be considered an advantage.
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), and Chinese word processing.
Excellent command of English and Chinese (Cantonese & Putonghua), both spoken and written, as the majority of our customers are overseas;
Excellent communication, interpersonal, negotiation and presentation skills.
Analytical mindset with the ability to analyse sales data and market trends to drive informed decision-making.
Pleasant, outgoing, self-motivated individual, who is able to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment.
Opportunities for global mobility, with occasional travels overseas for exhibitions, etc.
Fresh Graduates are welcome
Immediately available or short notice is preferred.

Seymus Filtration is a leading aftermarket filter supplier, specialising in construction machinery heavy duty filters. Young and joyful working environment

Title: Business Growth Intern
Job Description:
iSpeech is a rapidly growing EdTech startup based out of Hong Kong and Singapore, providing language and child growth education by harnessing the power of Storytelling with a vision to empower all children to shape their own unique future by growing their curiosity and desire to acquire knowledge.
  Want to be part of us to bring a difference to child education? We are looking for a Growth Intern to involve into the growth strategy planning and hands-on execution of growth marketing.
  What you will be doing:
  Support the daily hands-on operations of growth marketing
Work closely with the growth team to solve the most critical business problems
Plan and execute initiatives with guidance and support to crack the code
Learn and become good at a number of tasks related to the startup and will come out of the internship with a strong knowledge of how a company operates, how it is marketed, and ultimately, how companies grow incrementally
Skills & Requirements:
What we are looking for:
Current university students
Strong proficiency in Canva, with video editing skills considered a bonus
Highly motivated and hard working
Believing in his or her own ability to "getting stuff done" and "getting to solutions"
A quick learner and someone who is always open to learning something new every day
Be a good team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Creative personality and someone who has a "street hustle" mentality
Data-driven and strong ability in analyzing data to derive insights and make decisions
Adaptable, open-minded, and comfortable to work with ambiguity and change in the fast paced startup environment
Ability to read, write, and speak English, Cantonese, and Mandarin
About Company:
iSpeech is a rapidly growing EdTech startup based out of Hong Kong and Singapore, providing language and child growth education by harnessing the power of Storytelling and AI-powered language analysis with a vision to empower all children to shape their own unique future by growing their curiosity and desire to acquire knowledge.

Title: Software Engineer I (New Graduate 2025)
Employment Mode: Full Time, Graduate, Job at oversea location
Job Description:
Job Description
Software Engineer I
Since our establishment in 2012, Money Forward has launched more than 55 products. Our service areas include:
Services for individual users
Corporate cloud services
Corporate consulting services
Corporate financial services
Services for financial institutions
You will be responsible for the following tasks:
Backend Development
Frontend Development
Mobile Application Development
The team assignment is determined before you join the company, taking into account your preference, evaluation during the selection process, and aptitude.
Tech Stack:
Frontend: JavaScript/TypeScript
Backend: Ruby/Go/Kotlin/Java/Python/Rust
Mobile: Android (Kotlin/Java), iOS (Swift/Objective-C), Cross Platform: Dart (Flutter)
Skills & Requirements:
Eligibility for Application of New Graduate
Eligibility:
Candidates have less than one year of full-time work experience
If you already have more than one year of full-time work experience, we recommend exploring other positions through the link here!
Graduation Timing:
For November 2025 entry: Candidates who are expected to graduate between November 2024 and May 2025 are eligible
*The application period for April 2025 entry has closed.
Qualifications
Have a bachelor's degree or higher (Computer Science, Information Technologies, etc.) *Please check the detail mentioned in "Eligibility for Application of New Graduate"
Have an excellent academic record
Have internship experience related to software development (more than 3 months)
Have coding experience (at internship, school or individual projects, etc.)
Practical web application development experience is a plus
Have the shared belief in Money Forward's Mission/Vision/Values/Culture
Have strong interests in relocating to and working in Japan after graduation
Annual salary
5 million JPY or higher.
*Including fixed overtime work allowance of 45 hours for regular, non-legal hours, legal holidays and 40 hours for late-night work.
Location, Hybrid Work
As a standard practice, a minimum of 2 days work from office attendance is mandatory, designated as team office days. Additionally, employees are encouraged to spend 3 or more days in the office.
The specific "team office days" may vary depending on the assigned team.
This policy may be subject to change based on the company's needs and work circumstances.
Vacations
Two days off per week (Saturday and Sunday)
Japanese national holidays
Paid holiday: 10 days (first year) *Number of paid holidays increases (+1 day) every year up to 20 days a year.
Summer vacation days: 3 days
Winter vacation days: 2 days
Benefit
Health insurance
Employee stock ownership plan
Full transportation coverage
Neighborhood housing allowance
Neighborhood moving allowance
Copyright of OSS belongs to individuals
Award system (MVP, Culture Hero)
Seminar participation support
Book purchases
The latest computer (if considered necessary for work, limitless upgrade on specs and purchases of peripheral equipment are allowed.)
Relocation Support for Overseas Candidates
Working Visa
Flight ticket to Japan
Relocation Bonus
Temporary fully furnished apartment for the first month
Career Support
New employee orientation and training for new graduates
Trainer & mentor assignment
Grade / Personnel Evaluation System (twice a year)
MF Challenge System (Career formation support system where you can apply for vacant positions in the other departments in the company)
Selection Process
Document Screening
↓
Coding Assignment
↓
HR Meeting
↓
First Interview
↓
Aptitude Test
↓
Final Interview
↓
Job Offer and Meeting
*The selection process may change
Fields of Study: Computer & Information Sciences, Computer Science & Engineering, Computing, Computing & Software Technologies, Computing Mathematics
Education Level (pursuing / obtained): Bachelor, Master / Postgraduate Diploma, Doctorate or above
About Company:
Company Description
Money Forward is one of the fastest-growing Fintech companies in Japan. Since its establishment, we have launched more than 55 products in order to achieve our company's Mission, "Money Forward. Move your life forward."
To continue maintaining our high overall growth rate, we are expanding our market internationally with the ultimate aim of becoming a "Global Tech Giant."
As a start-up, Money Forward values fair opportunities for everyone to take on new challenges, regardless of age, nationality, or educational background. Because of the expansion of our business field overseas, we are currently prompting the Englishnization of the engineering organization by the end of November 2024 to attract many talented engineers both domestically and internationally. To guarantee fair opportunities for all non-Japanese natives, we do not require Japanese proficiency, not only in the screening process but also after joining.
These efforts towards Englishnization resulted in the entire organization becoming more diverse, with employees from more than 30 different countries now working in the company including those from Africa, Asia, Europe, North America and South America.
To ensure that employees working in Japan for the first time can fully engage in their work, we have prepared comprehensive relocation packages that include flight ticket, visa sponsorship, airport pick-up, temporary accommodation, and more.
Money Forward Culture
Our company's Vision is "Becoming the financial platform for all."
"Money" may be nothing more than a tool for living. However, it is also essential for guarding ourselves and our families, as well as for realizing our dreams.
We contribute to building a better society by providing services that enable users to "see money in a positive light and broaden their range of opportunities," thereby significantly enriching their lives.
In order to achieve our goal, Money Forward has cherished its Mission, Vision, Values, and Culture. We are looking for those who resonate with our passion, so please take a look at the Money Forward Culture Deck first!
Address: 21F Tamachi Station Tower S, 3-1-21 Shibaura, Minato-ku, Tokyo 108-0023

Title: Trainee - PXS IT Engineer

What We Offer
Your life doesn’t revolve around your job. So, find the job that revolves around your life.
The Trainee role is a full time 24-month contract with Societe Generale where you will have access to a diverse range of training materials to help you succeed, covering various aspects of businesses, including but not limited to technical skills, leadership development, communication skills, client service and relationship management. Behavioral Skills:

About Company:
Company Description:
Societe Generale is one of the leading European financial services groups. Based on a diversified and integrated banking model, the Group combines financial strength and proven expertise in innovation with a strategy of sustainable growth. Committed to the positive transformations of the world’s societies and economies, Societe Generale seeks to build together with its clients, a better and sustainable future through responsible and innovative financial solutions. Active in the real economy for over 160 years, with a solid position in Europe and connected to the rest of the world, Societe Generale has over 126,000 employees in 65 countries and supports 25 million individual clients, businesses and institutional investors worldwide (figures as of January 2024). We have a presence in 11 locations across Asia Pacific. With our regional headquarters in Hong Kong – a core hub of the worldwide Societe Generale Group – we employ around 2,200 employees in the region. In addition, Societe Generale's Global Solution Centre (SGGSC) in Bangalore and Chennai supports the Group in Asia Pacific and globally with customized business solutions.
We are an equal opportunities employer, and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. Title: Marketing Executive
Job Description:
Job Summary:
As a Marketing Executive, you'll build and grow the community for our new DeFi protocol by managing social media channels like Twitter and Discord, engaging with members, and developing partnerships with Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs).
This role also involves broader marketing initiatives, including public relations and event coordination. Join Amber to challenge yourself and make a significant impact!
  Key Responsibilities:
Community Management & Growth:
Develop and execute strategies to build and engage with the community on Twitter, Discord, and other relevant platforms.
Foster positive discussions, address community questions, and organize community events.
Social Media Management:
Create, schedule, and manage content across social channels.
Monitor social media trends, respond to feedback, and analyze performance.
Partnership Development:
Identify and collaborate with KOLs and influencers to promote the project.
Manage relationships with partners to enhance visibility.
Marketing Support and Collaboration:
Assist with public relations, event planning, and general marketing activities while working with other departments to gather community feedback and insights.
Handle additional responsibilities as needed, supporting various marketing efforts.
Skills & Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.
Proven experience in community management or social media roles, preferably in the blockchain or DeFi space is a huge advantage.
Strong understanding of social media platforms, particularly Twitter and Discord.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Experience in building partnerships and engaging with influencers is a plus.
Willingness to learn new things and adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment.
Proficient in English and Chinese, with strong writing skills in both; Mandarin speaking is essential.
About Company:
Amber Group is a global leading digital asset company providing crypto financial services to both institutional and high-net-worth investors globally.
We offer best-in-class liquidity solutions and cutting-edge trading infrastructure across major exchanges, applications, and networks. With over $1 trillion in cumulative trading volume, our deep liquidity helps power the digital asset ecosystem.
Beyond trading, our full-suite of offerings includes wealth management, lending and investing products. But at our core, we focus on building strong relationships and delivering personalized service to help clients navigate this fast-growing industry.
At Amber, security is our #1 priority. We have invested years of effort and millions of dollars in cybersecurity, crypto-security, and operational security across the firm, with industry-leading certifications like SOC 2 Type II and ISO 27001.
Powered by a 400+ team of traders, technologists and engineers operating 24/7 globally, our technology and research capabilities are world-class. Yet we remain entrepreneurial, always seeking fresh ideas and risks worth taking. We are always interested in people who have an appetite for taking calculated risk, demonstrate a high level of original thinking and intellectual curiosity.
Address: Causeway Bay
Note: Amber Group opens its doors to the curious problem solver empowered to make an impact in shaping tomorrow. As a hyper-growth company since day 1, we continually invite talent to join our diverse, nimble and digitally-native teams. If this sounds like you, apply now, or get in touch with us today.
Job Categories:
Marketing / Market Research
PR / Event Management

Job Description:
Project Officer (Ref: 2400980)
Registry
The appointee will provide a wide range of administrative and executive support to the Academic Development Section of the Registry.  Duties include offering secretariat support to  committees or working groups or projects related to curriculum development and review, such as preparing minutes, reports, presentations, data and information research and perform any other duties as assigned by supervising officers.
