The appointment will be for a period of 2 years.
Skills & Requirements:
Applicants should have a Bachelor’s degree with several years of relevant full-time post-qualification work experience, preferably gained in the tertiary education sector. They should be attentive to detail and self-motivated with a strong sense of responsibility; able to work under pressure with good time management skill; be proficient in written and spoken English and Chinese (both Cantonese and Putonghua).  They should also possess good organizational and interpersonal skills to be able to working independently and also as a team.  Applicants with strong digital competency and knowledge in developing websites will be an advantage.
Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.
Initial appointment will be made on a fixed-term contract.  Fringe benefits include the University’s Voluntary Contributions to MPF Scheme or a contract-end lump sum payment (totaling up to 10% of the basic salary), leave, medical and dental benefits.
The University only accepts and considers applications submitted online for this post.  Applicants should complete the online application form and upload a full CV on or before 18 September 2024.  Applications which are incomplete or without the required documents may not be considered.  Personal data provided by applicants will be used for recruitment and other employment-related purposes.  For details of the Personal Information Collection Statement, please refer to http://www.eduhk.hk/jobsopp/index.php?glang=en.
All applications will be treated in strict confidence.  Only those who are shortlisted will be contacted.  The University reserves the right not to fill the position(s) advertised.  Since the incumbent’s work would involve contacts with persons aged under 18 and/or mentally incapacitated persons, prospective employee(s) will be required to undergo Sexual Conviction Record Check operated by the Hong Kong Police Force.

Title: 2025 Point72 Academy Investment Analyst Summer Internship Program - Hong Kong
Job Description:
Are you a student interested in pursuing a career in investing? If you are graduating between December 2025 and July 2026, we invite you to apply for our 8-week summer internship, taking place from June to August 2025. 
  Launch your investing career in the Point72 Academy, an equities analyst training program that will provide you with the tools and knowledge to build a career in our ever-evolving industry. Since 2015, the Academy has graduated more than 170 analysts onto our platform; some are portfolio managers today. 
  The Point72 Academy Summer Internship is a combination of classroom instruction, portfolio casework, and mentorship. The program is designed to give you insights into finance, research, and the workings of the public markets and prepare you for the full-time Academy Associate Program. 
  During the internship, you will: 
Acquire fundamental knowledge and skills necessary to contribute as an analyst, alongside your peers. 
Receive training in accounting, modeling, presenting, and compliance. 
Collaborate with an investment team, gaining firsthand experience of the daily life of an equities analyst and exposure to one of the sectors covered by our Portfolio Managers. 
Work closely with Academy coaches, delving deeper into data analysis and preparing a final pitch on an investment idea.
Skills & Requirements:
WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:  
We welcome students from all academic disciplines. Your field of study or major is not a determining factor; we seek individuals who can effectively manage teamwork, exhibit integrity, possess intellectual curiosity, demonstrate leadership potential, and express a keen interest in the financial markets. 
Students should have a high enthusiasm for the financial services industry. Interest in analyzing companies and looking at stocks is recommended given the project-based nature of this program. 
Candidates with excellent communication skills (verbal and written) and high levels of self-motivation.  
  WE WANT YOU TO APPLY IF YOU ARE:  
A current student who will graduate from university between December 2025 and July 2026. 
Fascinated by research and problem-solving, relentlessly curious, and constantly expanding your horizons. 
Committed to continued success in your academic and professional career with the highest levels of professionalism, integrity, and excellence. 
Commitment to the highest ethical standards 
Highly self-driven and motivated to explore a career in finance. 
  WHAT TO EXPECT:  
Your online application, essays and resume will serve as an introduction to who you are as a candidate. Once you complete the online application, we will begin reviewing your profile. 
Selected candidates will then receive an email invitation to participate in a case study, allowing you to showcase your experiences and demonstrate your business acumen.  
Following submission and review of your case study, the next step would be virtual one on one interviews with various members of the Academy team, if selected.
About Company:
ABOUT POINT72 
Point72 is a global asset management firm that prioritizes developing the careers of our portfolio managers (PMs) and analysts. For 30 years, we have been empowering our investment professionals to pursue greatness. Here, you can play to your strengths and grow your career as an investor, learn from peers with proven expertise, and leverage world-class resources. 
  We’re a firm that thrives on ideas, and we’ve found that the Point72 Academy has provided us with diverse viewpoints and perspectives, and we are able to offer support in their growth and development as analysts and portfolio managers.
Address: 12/F, Chater House, 8 Connaught Road Central
Note:
- Please indicate your GPA including the GPA scale
- Academic record (official or unofficial transcript or grade report)
- Please note that any use of GenAI is strictly prohibited when completing this application.

本校校訓為「務本力學」，致力培育學生德智體群美五育的均衡發展，使學生除掌握學科知識外，更能懂得如何承擔家庭及社會的責任，成為良好公民。

Fresh graduates are welcome.
Mature, self-motivated and strong sense of responsibility.

Good command in both written and spoken Cantonese, English and Mandarin.
Responsible, detail-oriented, flexible and good team player.
Ability in problem solving.

About Company: KAS Group Asia (KGA) is the exclusive direct sourcing arm of Kmart Group that operate the iconic retail brands Kmart and Target in Australia. KGA’s operations span the largest sourcing markets across Asia including China, India, Bangladesh, Pakistan, Cambodia, Indonesia and Vietnam, supporting an annual sourcing capability of US$ 2.8 billion.

About Company:
About Bureau Veritas
Bureau Veritas is a world leader in laboratory testing, inspection and certification services. Created in 1828, the Group has more than 82,000 employees located in more than 1,600 offices and laboratories around the globe. Bureau Veritas helps its clients
improve their performance by offering services and innovative solutions in order to ensure that their assets, products, infrastructure and processes meet standards and regulations in terms of quality, health and safety, environmental protection and social
responsibility. Website: www.bureauveritas.com
BV Consumer Products Services is a world-leading concept-to-consumer supply chain solutions partner working with organizations throughout the supply chain. With well in excess of 100 offices and laboratories spread around the world, we are proud to be
the quality managers for many of the world’s leading brands, retailers and their supply chains.
With a presence in every major sourcing and selling territory around the world, our testing, inspection, certification and advisory solutions help companies making, distributing or selling consumer and technology products to improve their: product quality,
safety, connectivity, security and environmental compliance, sourcing flexibility, speed-to-market, profitability and brand security throughout the supply chain. Our product testing include soft goods, hard goods, toys, premium and juvenile products, etc. Website: www.cps.bureauveritas.com
To cope with our continuous development, we cordially invite you to join as one of our professional associates.

Title: Assistant Company Secretarial Officer
Education Level (pursuing / obtained): Master / Postgraduate Diploma, Bachelor, Higher Diploma / Associate Degree
About Company:
EcoCeres, Inc. (“EcoCeres”) is an innovative advanced biorefinery company with robust R&D capacity and excellent ESG performance. We proactively promote and support sustainability across borders.
We believe nature’s own harmony is the key to solving climate change.
We turn biomass wastes into 100% green energy & materials, for decarbonising your travel and everyday life.
With the belief that maintaining nature’s own harmony is the key to solving the climate change issues, EcoCeres has a strategic focus on turning biomass wastes into biofuels and biopolymers.
We are one of the few players in the world deploying our own proprietary technologies to produce Hydrotreated Vegetable Oils (HVO), a renewable diesel fuel, Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF), a jet fuel substitute, and Cellulosic Ethanol (CE), a gasoline blend-substitute, at a scale that can help global markets fulfil greenhouse gas (GHG) reduction targets and requirements.
Additionally, we are developing Green Hydrogen and other innovative sustainable products, in order to build an advanced biorefinery platform that encompasses biofuels and biopolymers. We aim to become a key player in driving the global energy transition while advancing the holistic decarbonisation journey to replace fossil fuels.
Address: Unit 2302-2303, 23/F, Tower 2, The Quayside, 77 Hoi Bun Road, Kwun Tong, Hong Kong

协助跟踪港股以及美国中概股，进行相关业务分析和处理；
协助团队研究股票基本面和市场面情况，分析市场信息；
协助团队进行行业研究并撰写研究报告。
Skills & Requirements:
任职条件
香港本地大学在读的本科或硕士研究生，具有金融、经济、财务会计等相关教育背景优先考虑；
有金融类、投资类岗位实习或相关工作经验者优先考虑；
财务知识和技能扎实；
中英文都达到作为工作语言水平，能独立撰写中英文报告并陈述思维过程；
具备优秀的学习能力、沟通能力、团队合作能力和解决问题能力，能在压力下出色的完成工作；
每周至少现场实习3天以上，连续实习时间不少于3个月。
About Company: 弘毅投资成立于2003年，是中国领先的投资管理机构，目前拥有私募股权投资、不动产投资、风险创投、对冲基金、公募基金等业务板块，管理资金总规模达1000亿人民币。金涌投资是一家多经理、多策略、多资产类别的二级市场投资机构，总部位于香港，投资业务起源于弘毅投资的对冲基金部门，持香港证监会颁发的1号（证券交易）、4号（证券咨询）、9号（资产管理）牌照。
Address: 香港中環交易廣場第1座27樓2701室

Skills & Requirements:
須具認可社會工作文憑或社會工作副學士學位
已根據社會工作者註冊條例登記成為註冊社工
具良好中﹑英文書寫能力
具基本電腦知識，包括中文打字
具帶領活動及青年工作之經驗
具多元興趣及技能，如運動、藝術或STEM等可獲優先考慮

工作與兒童有關，準僱員需自願進行《性罪行定罪紀錄查核》
About Company:
香港青年協會（簡稱青協）於1960年成立，是香港最具規模的非牟利青年服務機構。主要宗旨是為青少年提供專業而多元化的服務及活動，使青少年在德、智、體、群、美等各方面獲得均衡發展；其經費主要來自政府津貼、公益金撥款、賽馬會捐助、信託基金、活動收費、企業及個人捐獻等。
青協設有會員制度與各項專業服務，為全港青年及家庭提供支援及有益身心的活動。轄下超過80個服務單位，每年提供超過25,000項活動，參與人次接近600。青協服務以青年為本，致力拓展下列12項「核心服務」，以回應青少年不斷轉變的需要；同時亦透過「青協 會員易」(easymember.hk)平台及青協手機應用程式，全面聯繫逾45萬名登記會員。
The Hong Kong Federation of Youth Groups (HKFYG) is the city's largest youth service organisation. Since its establishment in 1960, the HKFYG has been providing opportunities and facilities for the social, educational, cultural and physical development of young people. Income is obtained primarily from government subvention, as well as grants from the Community Chest of Hong Kong, the Hong Kong Jockey Club Charities Trust, other trust funds, programme fees, and both private and corporate donations.
The HKFYG, through its youth membership network, provides quality services that address the issues and concerns of young people and promotes healthy all-round development. Over 70 service units organise more than 20,000 activities annually, with attendance to the various programmes now standing at five million a year. Over 450,000 registered members are engaged through the online platform, easymember.hk and the HKFYG app.
Address: 21/F, The Hong Kong Federation of Youth Groups Building 21 Pak Fuk Road, North Point, Hong Kong

Title: Associate, Account Management
Job Description:
Work Scope
Delight our clients with best-in-class services, solutions and technology: obsessed with client outcomes, doing what it takes to deliver the client’s expectations
Connect with global teams to work on end-to-end solutions
Fix problems in clients’ supply chain
Working Environment
Mutli-cultural - We have people coming from all around the world and different backgrounds. We emphasize D&I and encourage cultural exchange in the office. 
Dynamic - In this ever-changing market, our team always adjusts ourselves and the processes for accommodating all the day to day challenges. You will be part of it and drive all these changes.  
Agility - We allow the team to make right decisions for our clients & the company. We trust our people to do the best things they can. 
Support - We have all the expertises in the company to provide necessary support to you in terms of training, solutions and mentorship. As long as you stay curious, you will always find something to learn in this company.
Fun - You will always be invited to team activities, office wise functions, sports events and industry seminars. We want our employees to have work-life balance and socialize with different people.
Skills & Requirements:
Bachelor / master degree
1-3 years working experiences. Fresh graduates are welcome. 
A background in logistics, freight forwarding, or supply chain is a plus
Client-centric mindset
Ability to demonstrate hands-on, process-oriented, structured thinking with strong problem-solving skills
Fluency in English and Mandarin is preferred
About Company:
Flexport is the platform that coordinates global logistics from factory to customer door — empowering businesses to ship anywhere, sell everywhere and grow faster.
Our Mission
Tired of the traditional operation model of the freight forwarding industry? Want to shake and disrupt the industry in a healthy manner? At Flexport, it’s our mission to make global trade easier for everyone.  We are changing the industry with technology associated with our talents and state of the art infrastructure.
Address: 26/F, Tower 5, The Gateway, Harbour City, 15 Canton Road, Tsim Sha Tsui
Job Categories:
Logistics / Supply Chain
Sales / Account Servicing / Business Development

青協設有會員制度與各項專業服務，為全港青年及家庭提供支援及有益身心的活動。轄下超過80個服務單位，每年提供超過25,000項活動，參與人次接近600。青協服務以青年為本，致力拓展下列12項「核心服務」，以回應青少年不斷轉變的需要；同時亦透過「青協 會員易」(easymember.hk)平台及青協手機應用程式，全面聯繫逾45萬名登記會員。
Address: 21/F, The Hong Kong Federation of Youth Groups Building 21 Pak Fuk Road, North Point, Hong Kong
Note: 求職者可於erecruit.hkfyg.org.hk遞交網上申請；或於erecruit.hkfyg.org.hk/ApplicationForm.doc下載申請表格, 填妥後電郵 (recruit@hkfyg.org.hk) 香港青年協會；或將履歷表及要求待遇經Jijis “Apply Now”網上申請。

Title: Payroll Assistant, Finance
Job Description:
Join our team as an Assistant specializing in Payroll, where you'll play a crucial role in managing payroll operations for a diverse workforce of over 2000 employees in Hong Kong.
Oversee end-to-end payroll processes, ensuring accurate and timely execution.
Handling various components such as payroll execution, Mandatory Provident Fund (MPF) contributions, and gratuity calculations, while addressing employee inquiries with professionalism and efficiency.
Assist in staff offboarding procedures, address timesheet inquiries, and ensure operational smoothness.
Work closely with the Human Resources team to guarantee data accuracy and seamless integration between payroll and HR systems.
Aid in payroll transformation efforts by engaging in User Acceptance Testing (UAT), conducting data mining activities, and offering feedback on user experience.
Manage any additional tasks associated with payroll operations when necessary.

Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Human Resources or related discipline.
Fresh Graduate will also be considered
Minimum 1 years of experience in payroll operation, preferably with experience in gratuity calculation.
Familiarity with the Government Master Pay Scale will be an advantage.

Strong numerical and detail-oriented skills.
Fields of Study: Accounting & Finance, Business Administration, Human Resources & Labour Relations, Psychology, Hotel & Tourism Management

Title: Point72 Academy Investment Analyst Program for Upcoming Graduates (2025 – HK)
Job Description:
We’re training the next generation of Point72 investors 
The Point72 Academy Investment Analyst Program for Upcoming Graduates is a paid ten-month training program designed to introduce you to the buy-side and prepare you for a potential career as an analyst at Point72.   
We’re looking for current students graduating between December 2024 and July 2025 to join our 2025 classes.  
After successfully completing the program, you’ll have the opportunity to join a network of more than 170 Point72 Academy graduates who we have placed at our firm, as of April 2024. If you are successfully placed as an analyst, you will have access to mentorship and professional development resources that can help you progress your career for years to come.  
 
What you’ll do 
Join us to learn the fundamental research and analysis skills needed to be an analyst at Point72 as you apply your intellectual curiosity in a role that prizes creativity, autonomy, and analytical rigor. The program begins with eight months of formal training followed by two months of rotations with investment teams or similar roles on our platform. Best of all, upon successful program graduation, you may have the chance to join an investing team as a full-time analyst.  
Develop sophisticated company analysis and modeling skills from our Academy faculty, investment professionals, and professors from some of the world’s leading universities.
Learn statistics, accounting, financial modeling, data analysis, coding, and more.
Apply the skills you’ve developed to real-life situations as you rotate with up to three investing teams.
Gain firsthand experience and valuable mentorship from our investment professionals during your rotations.
Upon Successful Graduation: The Analyst Role 
You may have the opportunity to become an equity research analyst at Point72, where you can apply your financial acumen and curiosity to help shape your team’s investment strategies as you:  
Develop sophisticated financial models to help you understand the businesses you cover and how they are changing
Perform company channel checks; attend industry events; build relationships with industry contacts, sell-side analysts, and research associates; analyze data sets; and conduct other research
Constantly develop your skills through coaching from your Portfolio Manager and by using the full breadth of the Professional Development resources available to you
Conduct yourself with the highest levels of professionalism, integrity, ethics, and excellence
Skills & Requirements:
WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:  
We welcome students from all academic disciplines. Your field of study or major is not a determining factor; we seek individuals who can effectively manage teamwork, exhibit integrity, possess intellectual curiosity, demonstrate leadership potential, and express a keen interest in the financial markets.
Students should have a high enthusiasm for the financial services industry. Interest in analyzing companies and looking at stocks is recommended given the project-based nature of this program.
Candidates with excellent communication skills (verbal and written) in an Asian language and high levels of self-motivation.
WE WANT YOU TO APPLY IF YOU ARE:  
A current student who will graduate from university between December 2024 and July 2025.
Fascinated by research and problem-solving, relentlessly curious, and constantly expanding your horizons.
Committed to continued success in your academic and professional career with the highest levels of professionalism, integrity, and excellence.
Commitment to the highest ethical standards.
Highly self-driven and motivated to explore a career in finance.
WHAT TO EXPECT:   
Your online application, essays, and resume will serve as an introduction to who you are as a candidate. Once you complete the online application, we will begin reviewing your profile.
Selected candidates will then receive an email invitation to participate in a case study, allowing you to showcase your experiences and demonstrate your business acumen.
Following submission and review of your case study, the next step would be virtual one on one interviews with various members of the Academy team, if selected.
About Company:
About Point72
Point72 Asset Management is a global firm led by Steven Cohen that invests in multiple asset classes and strategies worldwide. Resting on more than a quarter-century of investing experience, we seek to be the industry’s premier asset manager through delivering superior risk-adjusted returns, adhering to the highest ethical standards, and offering the greatest opportunities to the industry’s brightest talent. We’re inventing the future of finance by revolutionizing how we develop our people and how we use data to shape our thinking. For more information, visit www.Point72.com/working-here.
Point72 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Point72 is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment. Point72 complies with applicable, local, state and federal laws on the subject of equal employment opportunity.
Address: 12/F, Chater House, 8 Connaught Road Central

- Academic record (official or unofficial transcript or grade report)

Title: Analyst Intern (6-months), Private Equity Asia 2025
Job Description:
The Opportunity
Analyst Intern, Private Equity Asia 2025
  Group
Private Equity Asia (PE Asia) focuses on private equity investments in the Asia-Pacific region through funds and direct equity co-investments.
  For funds, we seek multi-year commitments to pan-Asia and region-focused funds in China, Japan, Australia, South Korea, India, and Southeast Asia. We partner primarily with funds of US$250 million or larger that seek minimum commitments of US$25 million.
  For direct equity co-investments, we seek to invest alongside Asia-based private equity sponsors in privately owned businesses. We generally target investments of US$25-50 million in buyout or growth equity transactions. We invest in businesses in Asia, or with an Asia-centric presence or growth angle.
  The PE Asia team is based in Hong Kong and is currently comprised of eight investment professionals. The team currently manages a portfolio in excess of US$4 billion and deploys over US$1 billion a year in new investments.  
  The Firm
Manulife Investment Management is the global wealth and asset management segment of Manulife Financial Corporation. We draw on more than 150 years of financial stewardship to partner with clients across our institutional, retail, and retirement businesses globally. Our specialist approach to money management includes the highly differentiated strategies of our fixed-income, specialized equity, multi-asset solutions, and private markets teams - along with access to specialized, unaffiliated asset managers from around the world through our multimanager model.
  Manulife Investment Management’s Private Equity and Credit group provides capital solutions ranging from senior and junior debt financing, equity co-investments, private equity secondaries, and primary fund commitments to leading managers across North America, Europe, and the Asia-Pacific region.
  Job description
The Investment Intern will be principally responsible for supporting the investment team in managing and monitoring the existing investment portfolio. The Investment Intern will also be responsible for supporting other aspects of the investment process, including due diligence on potential investments.
  What you will do: 
·         Assist in preparing periodic investment reviews on existing investments
·         Assist with ad hoc portfolio-related analytical projects and reporting initiatives
·         Assist with due diligence on fund partners across various geographies and fund strategies
·         Assist with due diligence on prospective equity co-investments including reviewing historical financial performance, industry dynamics and competitive analysis, valuation analysis and financial modelling
Skills & Requirements:
We are looking for someone with: 
·         Undergraduate or graduate students with a major in finance, economics, or business administration
·         Candidates should have a demonstrated passion for investing and interest in private market transactions
·         Strong English language verbal and written communications skills are required
·         Strong proficiency with Excel
·         Team player capable of working with various internal and external teams in a fast-paced environment
·         Ability to work with a minimum amount of supervision, demonstrating a high degree of initiative, judgement, and professionalism
About Company:
About Manulife and John Hancock
  Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services provider, helping people make their decisions easier and lives better. To learn more about us, visit https://www.manulife.com/en/about/our-story.html.
  Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer
  At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

Title: Data Science Internship - Advanced Analytics
Job Description:
About the Role:
Join Manulife’s Advanced Analytics team as a Data Science Intern, focusing on developing Generative AI Proof-of-Concepts (PoCs). Collaborate with data scientists to understand use cases, develop, document, and demonstrate the value of these solutions. This role requires rapid learning and adaptability.
  Roles and Responsibilities:
Conduct Generative AI PoCs using Python and the Azure ecosystem with guidance from senior team members.
Work closely with internal users to understand needs, develop, and test data and AI-driven solutions.
Collect internal and external data, including structured and unstructured data, through SQL, APIs, and web crawling.
Process numeric data, text, images, and videos based on downstream task requirements.
Build PoC applications with front-end, back-end, and APIs to demonstrate to stakeholders.
Support ad-hoc analytics tasks as needed.
Skills & Requirements:
Minimum Job Requirements:
University students eligible to work as intern in Hong Kong.
Preferred disciplines: Computer Science or STEM-related fields.
Proficiency in Python, Machine Learning, and Data Science. Previous exposure to Natural Language Processing (NLP) and/or Computer Vision (CV) is preferred.
Knowledge of Large Language Models, application development, and Azure or other cloud platforms.
Proficiency in English with good communication skills.
Preferred availability: at least 3 - 6 months, with minimal 4 working days per week.

With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Asia, Canada, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2022, we had more than 40,000 employees, over 116,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving over 34 million customers. At the end of 2022, we had $1.3 trillion (US$1.0 trillion) in assets under management and administration, including total invested assets of $0.4 trillion (US $0.3 trillion), and segregated funds net assets of $0.3 trillion (US$0.3 trillion). Title: Assistant Planner, Food, Gifts & Private Label
Job Description:
The Assistant Planner supports our Merchandising and Planning teams in their daily business and takes part in projects to drive category performances in collaboration with other teams. He/she will work in one of our brand/category teams and will support the management of Sales, Promotions & Margins, as well as Orders & Inventory. 
  Management of Purchase Orders (POs) 
- By tracking and updating orders to ensure timely delivery and stock availability. 
- Coordination with brand partners externally, and logistics, data & finance teams internally 
Support in all pricing-related topics, particularly for our monthly promotional activities 
- Creation of Price Changes & Promotions in system 
- Follow-up on execution with stores 
Support in Purchase Forecast 
- Stock & Sales management  
- Follow-up with brand partners and providing insight based on market sense 
Maintenance of relevant category reports 
Management of return logistics and other merchandising topics with brand partners 
Support of ad-hoc and improvement projects 
Assist in data analysis, including sales trends, inventory levels and performance metrics. 
Participate in the review of sales forecasts and contribute to insights to improve accuracy. 
Work closely with the Allocation team and stores to make sure stores are fully in stock.  
Assist in preparing reports and presentations for internal meetings.
Skills & Requirements:
University degree is a must 
Previous merchandising and/or planning experience preferred 
Proficient in MS Excel, MS Word, Outlook 
Excellent at problem solving and handling multiple priorities 
Consistency, accuracy, and agility are highly preferred work quality 
Customer focus (internal customer) and interpersonal savvy 
Strong analytical skills with ability to interpret data trend with a keen eye for detail. 
Enthusiasm to learn and growth in the field of retail planning/FMCG field. 
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.  
Prior experience in retail, planning or FMCG field is a plus.

Title: Marketing Intern
Job Description:
This internship program in Hong Kong is a great
opportunity for students to gain understanding and
working experience in the sexual wellness industry.

Internship tasks may cover various aspects of
business work such as:

1. Organize marketing materials for website updates.
2. Research and suggest social media ideas to reach
target audiences.
3. Plan and shoot viral videos for the shop/products.
4. Manage our social media content for teenager
engagement. 
Working days: every Tuesday & Thursday

Working hours: 9:00am-  6:00pm (or negotiable)
Skills & Requirements:
Students of an undergraduate degree program in any
discipline. The candidate should understand the
youngster culture and media to reach teenagers.
He/She must be authorized to work in Hong Kong
and able to speak English, Cantonese and Mandarin.

We not only look at academic performance; your
character, qualitative and analytical capability,
communication skills and ability to work in a multidisciplinary team are also important.
How to apply?

Please submit your application with a 3-month plan

About Company:
Headquartered in Hong Kong, Trade Anywhere Ltd. (TAL) is a global professional distributor of sexual wellness products. With more than 7,900 total distribution points worldwide - 6,200 convenience stores, 1,500 chain drugstores, and 210 adult stores, we guarantee all brands the fastest and most efficient way to expose to the global market, including both adult networks and modern trade networks.

The first brand that TAL represented was Sagami from Japan, fully responsible for the distribution to all outlets in Hong Kong, for instance, Mannings, Watsons, 7-Eleven, Circle-K etc. With a joint effort between TAL & Sagami, Sagami outperformed all market leaders in quantity and value growth. The successful launch of Sagami Original 0.01/0.02 PU Condoms and other Sagami products has marked a historic milestone for TAL.

TAL kept growing throughout the years by expanding the distribution of Sagami to Taiwan in 2015, Singapore in 2018, and the UK in 2019. TAL also represented well-known brands in the erotic industry, including Tenga, Womanizer, We-Vibe, Arcwave, 50 Shades of Grey, and ROMP in Hong Kong.

Nowadays, TAL is not just a distributor but also an all-round partner. We have the comprehensive expertise to assist in brand development - managing marketing campaigns, joint promotion with local organizations, event management, and brand strategic planning.
Application Methods: Please address your application to : HR

Since its inception in 2006, Fine Art Asia has attracted an increasing number of renowned international galleries. Fine Art Asia is unique: it is the only fair in Asia to showcase a wide range of collectible fine art from Asia and the West.
In 2020, Fine Art Asia proudly launched its brand-new logo reflecting its status as a leading international art fair which has earned a worldwide reputation for quality and elegance.

The Yew Chung Education Foundation (YCEF) is a registered non-profit association in Hong Kong, and the school sponsoring body of Yew Chung International School of Hong Kong (YCIS-Hong Kong) and the Yew Chung College of Early Childhood Education (YCCECE).

YCIS is the first homegrown and original international school in Hong Kong, and YCCECE is Hong Kong’s first specialist institute in early childhood education. With the two networks of schools, the Foundation create a virtuous cycle of quality education in Hong Kong and beyond, beginning with the child in mind.

We are above all committed to equipping students with an inner moral compass, empowering them to take the helm and steer through human complexities with honesty, compassion and confidence. We also strive to further contribute to society by nurturing passionate and innovative early childhood educators at the tertiary level, who can advocate and bring about improvement in the field, giving future generations a strong positive start.

With its sister institutions, YCEF is part of a network of international kindergartens, primary and secondary schools that provides quality education to over 10,000 students, spanning from infancy to tertiary, across 20 locations in Hong Kong, mainland China, Somerset in the UK and Silicon Valley in the US.

For more info about YCEF, please visit our website at: http://www.ycef.com/en/

About Company:
香港青年協會（簡稱青協）於1960年成立，是香港最具規模的非牟利青年服務機構。主要宗旨是為青少年提供專業而多元化的服務及活動，使青少年在德、智、體、群、美等各方面獲得均衡發展；其經費主要來自政府津貼、公益金撥款、賽馬會捐助、信託基金、活動收費、企業及個人捐獻等。
青協設有會員制度與各項專業服務，為全港青年及家庭提供支援及有益身心的活動。轄下超過80個服務單位，每年提供超過25,000項活動，參與人次接近600。青協服務以青年為本，致力拓展下列12項「核心服務」，以回應青少年不斷轉變的需要；同時亦透過「青協 會員易」(easymember.hk)平台及青協手機應用程式，全面聯繫逾45萬名登記會員。
Address: 21/F, The Hong Kong Federation of Youth Groups Building 21 Pak Fuk Road, North Point, Hong Kong

Green Auctioneers is the first French auction house established in Hong Kong in 2022, with a specialty in ladies' watches, pocket watches, and vintage timepieces.  Green Auctioneers advocates vintage watches, from iconic models to unique piece and limited editions.
We strive for carving a fine niche for ladies' watches, pocket watches, vintage timepieces, and luxury objects by our curated auctions for watch enthusiasts and collectors around the globe.
We are people-centric in providing professional services and demonstrating our company values. Our auctions showcase strong personalities, unique tastes, and solid knowledge to our clients and the market.

Title: AI Research Intern
Job Description: We are looking for a curious and motivated AI Research Intern to join our team. This role offers a unique opportunity to get hands-on experience in AI and machine learning, working alongside experienced professionals. You’ll be involved in various aspects of AI model development, from data preparation and analysis to model training and evaluation.
Skills & Requirements:
Key Responsibilities:
- Assist in preparing and organizing datasets for AI model training.
- Collaborate with the AI development team on experiments and testing of models.
- Contribute to the development and implementation of new AI algorithms.
- Provide support in refining models to improve accuracy and performance.
- Participate in team discussions and brainstorming sessions to explore innovative solutions.

Qualifications:
- A strong interest in AI, machine learning, and data science.
- Basic understanding of AI concepts, algorithms, and tools.
- Proficiency in Python is required.
- Familiarity with data processing and analysis tools (e.g., pandas, NumPy).
- Experience with labeling tools such as LabelImg, LabelMe, Label Studio, or CVAT is a plus.
- Eagerness to learn and take on new challenges.
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Fields of Study: Computer Science & Engineering, Artifical Intelligence: Systems & Technologies, Big Data Technology, Land Surveying & Geo-informatics
Education Level (pursuing / obtained): Bachelor, Master / Postgraduate Diploma, Doctorate or above
About Company:
Insight Robotics was founded in 2009 by entrepreneurs and robotics experts in Hong Kong. Our mission is to enable active risk management of the world's assets by generating and making sense of data.  Our company focuses on combining visual and other remote sensing technologies with artificial intelligence-based analytics to create operational improvements by detecting any targets and changes for large-scale asset monitoring and protection.  We also use our technology expertise to create technology-enabled services for our clients from both the public and private sectors.  Nowadays, our core operations and businesses cover Europe, Latin America, Southeast Asia, Korea, Hong Kong SAR, and China.
Please feel free to visit our company's website, www.insightrobotics.com, to acquire more information about our company and our product solutions.
Application Methods: Please address your application to : Ms Lam
Address: Unit 316, 3/F, Building 16W, Phase 3 Hong Kong Science Park, Shatin, N.T., Hong Kong

Research & Development

Student or fresh graduates of strong interest in digital marketing content development are welcomed

Title: Trading Engineering Intern
Job Description:
Key Responsibilities:
Algorithm Development: Assist in the design, development, and testing of trading algorithms and strategies. Apply quantitative techniques to enhance the performance of trading systems.
Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Use statistical methods to inform trading decisions and strategy development.
Coding and Scripting: Develop and maintain Python scripts and tools for data analysis, backtesting, and real-time trading operations. Ensure code quality and efficiency.
Performance Monitoring: Monitor the performance of trading strategies and systems. Implement improvements based on performance metrics and feedback.
Research Support: Contribute to research projects by conducting literature reviews, backtesting strategies, and preparing reports on findings.
Collaboration: Work closely with trading engineers, data scientists, and quantitative analysts to understand requirements and deliver technical solutions.
Skills & Requirements:
Qualifications:
Educational Background: Pursuing or recently completed a degree in Financial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python programming, with experience in libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and SciPy. Knowledge of SQL and data manipulation tools is a plus.
Quantitative Skills: Strong understanding of statistical methods, financial modeling, and data analysis techniques.
Analytical Mindset: Ability to think critically and solve complex problems using quantitative approaches.
Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and attention to detail in coding and data analysis tasks.
Communication Skills: Effective written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present technical information clearly and concisely.
Passion for Crypto: Genuine interest in cryptocurrency markets and financial technologies is highly desirable.
About Company: Global in influence and crypto-native, HashKey Capital is a digital asset and blockchain leader helping institutions, founders and talents advance the blockchain industries. HashKey Capital, one of the largest crypto funds and the earliest institutional investor in Ethereum, has managed over US$1 billion in client assets since its inception, with over 500 investments in infrastructure, tools, and applications. With our deep knowledge across the blockchain ecosystem, HashKey Capital has built a robust network connecting founders, investors, developers, and regulators.
Job Categories:
IT / Programming
Banking and Finance Executive

About Company:
The Hong Kong Federation of Youth Groups (HKFYG) is the city's largest youth service organisation. Since its establishment in 1960, the HKFYG has been providing opportunities and facilities for the social, educational, cultural and physical development of young people. Income is obtained primarily from government subvention, as well as grants from the Community Chest of Hong Kong, the Hong Kong Jockey Club Charities Trust, other trust funds, programme fees, and both private and corporate donations.
The HKFYG, through its youth membership network, provides quality services that address the issues and concerns of young people and promotes healthy all-round development. Over 70 service units organise more than 20,000 activities annually, with attendance to the various programmes now standing at five million a year. Over 450,000 registered members are engaged through the online platform, easymember.hk and the HKFYG app.
Address: 21/F, The Hong Kong Federation of Youth Groups Building 21 Pak Fuk Road, North Point, Hong Kong

Title: 2025 Graduate Recruitment
Company: Ove Arup & Partners Hong Kong Ltd
Job Description:
Who are we looking for?
You should be a well motivated and creative Graduate who wants to work in Engineering, Planning or Design Consultancies in the following disciplines:
Architecture
Aviation
Building Envelope and Materials (Façade)
Building Services, Electrical, Mechanical, Transportation Engineering
Building Sustainability

Digital Services

Energy

Fire
Geotechnical, Geology, Engineering Geology, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Earth Sciences

Landscape Architecture

Railway System
Structures
Sustainable Structural and Fire Engineering
Transport Consulting
Urban Planning, Urban Design
Water Engineering & Waste Management
You will be involved in assisting project design works; preparing calculations and drawings; modelling of engineering behaviour, etc.
Skills & Requirements:
Your Arup Journey
We encourage our graduates to develop qualities of diligence and perseverance; and to enhance abilities of team excellence and innovation.
You will be offered a broad spectrum of diversity training and inclusion opportunities throughout your journey with Arup. You will meet all the graduates in East Asia Region through our stimulating and enjoyable Graduate Induction Programme in which the concept of equality, diversity & inclusion is integrated. Arup is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Caring Company, we strive to provide an equal, diverse and inclusive workplace for you.
You will achieve a professional status through project experience and structured training via our online learning platform and other in-house learning activities. You will be offered a well designed HKIE Scheme 'A' Training for majority of disciplines (where applicable). You will take part in Arup’s digital transformation to experience how the latest technologies change our life and work. In addition, you are encouraged to leverage the opportunities in cross-disciplinary rotation and international mobility programmes to rev up your career development.
Other Benefits:
5-day work
15-day annual leave
Overtime compensation
Chinese New Year bonus
Medical scheme (extended coverage to spouse and children)
Option between ORSO scheme and MPF
Profit share
Insurance coverage (Life, personal accidental & permanent total disability)
Flexible working arrangements
Rental Reimbursement Program
To learn more about our Graduate Programme, please visit us:
https://www.arup.com/careers/early-careers/graduates/east-asia-graduate-programme
Fields of Study: Architecture / Landscape Architecture, Building Surveying & Construction Management, Civil / Structural Engineering, Electrical / Electronic / Energy Engineering, Engineering, Geography / Urban Studies, Mechanical Engineering, Natural Resources / Environmental Sciences
Education Level (pursuing / obtained): Doctorate or above, Master / Postgraduate Diploma, Bachelor
About Company:
Are you passionate to make a difference where you live and work? At Arup, we do work that matters.  We are proud to be a diverse community of designers, planners, engineers, advisors and experts from many disciplines. Join Arup, and you will find yourself in a place where imagination, technology and rigour meet to solve some of the planet’s most urgent challenges.
We care about you and want you to perform at your best. Here you will have access to a wide range of opportunities to become a better version of yourself  We also offer flexible work arrangements to support your lifestyle and wellbeing.
We welcome candidates from all backgrounds, and provide an equal and inclusive environment for you to thrive in.  Join us to create a greener, better and more sustainable world!
Note:
Start here, go anywhere!
Act now and apply through our career website.
Please ensure you have provided full resume, academic transcripts and covering letter. Any outstanding documents may delay your application with us.
Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with the employer’s personal data policies, a copy of which is available on Arup’s Legal page.

Title: Quality Engineer
Job Description:
Job Purpose:
We are looking for a technically astute and energetic Quality Engineer to join us and participate in different projects, working closely with our cross-functional teams in Hong Kong and various regions. You will perform data-driven analysis of a product specifications, performance, and packaging requirements and follow up certification and testing requirements.
Key Accountabilities:
Support and develop products specification
Assist Quality team to update and maintain internal documentation 
Execute samples review according to inspection protocol
Verify components and materials specifications against BOM and product specifications down to the component level 
Communicate and follow up with colleagues in Shanghai, Shenzhen, Taiwan, Vietnam and India for routine quality issues
Other additional tasks and duties as assigned by the company case by case
Skills & Requirements:
University / College degree in Engineering / Manufacturing /
Material Science / Science / Mathematics & Statistics or other science subjects
1-2 years QC / QA experience, fresh graduates are welcome
Specification development experience in sourcing office or laboratory environment is an advantage
Good knowledge of product development and verification process, defect analysis and EU test requirements
Experience with product risk assessment is preferred
Good communication skills and commercial awareness
Robust personality, able to meet deadline
Knowledge in EU legislation and requirements is preferred (EU regulations and directives training will be provided)
Fluent in written and spoken English & Mandarin
Candidates with less experience will be considered as Assistant Quality Engineer
Fields of Study: Electrical / Electronic / Energy Engineering, Engineering, Industrial & Manufacturing Systems Engineering, Physical Sciences, Science
About Company: Birgma Asia is a multinational group engaged in the procurement of various products in Asia for export to Scandinavian countries to our group company - Biltema. Our product lines include but not limit to car parts & accessories, bicycles, boating equipment, hand tools, household DIY and construction materials, electronic products and leisure items.  Our Asian regional procurement operations currently include several offices in Asia.
Note:
We offer attractive remuneration package including 5-day work, 15 days annual leave, medical & dental insurance and other benefits to the right candidate. Interested candidates please send your FULL resume with current and expected salary and availability to recruitments@birgma.com.
Only short-listed candidates will be notified. All applications will be used for the purpose of recruitment only. Applicants not invited for interview within 6 weeks may consider their applications unsuccessful.
Job Categories:
Engineering - Electronic / Industrial / Electrical / Mechanical and others
Quality Control
Others

Title: Assistant Engineer (under Environmental Scheme A Training)
Company: Telemax Environmemtal and Energy Management Limited
Job Description:
Assist project teams to implement green building design and environmental planning and management
Provide technical supports to project teams on various environmental and sustainability studies
Conduct on-site measurement and computer simulation
Prepare documentation and submission for different green building certification (e.g. BEAM Plus / WELL / LEED etc)
Prepare technical reports, presentation and other project deliverables
Handle project team coordination and project meeting attendance
Skills & Requirements:
Degree/Master/PHD in Green Building, Sustainability,  Environmental, Mechanical, Building Services or other related disciplines
With previous CFD & Building Sustainability Simulation, Energy Modeling, Daylighting Simulation.etc experience
Self-Motivated and able to work independently
Good command of spoken and written Chinese, English and Mandarin
Previous experience in LEED,BEAM Plus, EIA and Water Treatment, EM&A, Green Mark and China Green Building Evaluation will be an advantage
Previous experience in consultancy firm is an advantage
Fields of Study: Environment & Resources Management, Environmental Engineering & Sustainable Development, Sustainability
Education Level (pursuing / obtained): Doctorate or above, Master / Postgraduate Diploma, Bachelor, Higher Diploma / Associate Degree
About Company:
Telemax Environmental and Energy Management Ltd. (TEEM) was established by a group of professionals specializing in Building Services, Environmental Protection, Green Buildings, Sustainability, Building Environment and Energy Engineering and Carbon Reduction. We work together to provide innovative and practical solutions to our clients. We strive to be the best through technological advancement, integrity, quality assurance and offer a multi-discipline expertise to serve our clients over the world.
http://www.telemaxeem.com/index.php

Note: Please bring photo (optional), original academic qualifications / transcript / reference letters for checking if necessary.

7.  Proficiency in MS Office (e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).

Title: Assistant Marketing Executive
Job Description:
Are you a recent graduate with a passion for marketing and a desire to kick-start your career? We have an exciting opportunity for a motivated, detail-oriented Assistant Marketing Executive to join our team and contribute to the growth and success of this dynamic brand.
As the Assistant Marketing Executive for ESDlife, you will have the chance to learn and grow your skills in supporting the development and execution of integrated marketing campaigns across various channels. Under the guidance of our experienced marketing team, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth implementation of marketing initiatives and contributing to the overall success of the ESDlife brand.
Key Responsibilities:
Assist in the development and execution of integrated marketing campaigns for ESDlife brand across digital, traditional marketing and event-based initiatives that align with the business goals
Coordinate with internal and external parties to ensure consistent and effective marketing communication and develop high quality marketing promotion materials 
Assist to source sponsorship, partnership opportunities and co-marketing campaigns to support the brand’s marketing efforts
Continuously monitor and prepare reports on campaign performance metrics, analyzing data to identify trends and insights
Conduct market research and stay up-to-date with the latest marketing trends, competitor activities, technologies, and industry best practices
Provide administrative support related to the execution of marketing projects
Skills & Requirements:
Qualifications:
University graduate with a degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field
Strong interest and enthusiasm for marketing, particularly in the consumer-facing brand space
Excellent organizational and project management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively
Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate cross-functionally
Proactive, detail-oriented, and committed to delivering high-quality work
Proficient in MS Office suite and familiar with project management and design tools
Eager to learn, grow, and contribute to the success of the ESDlife brand
  This is an excellent opportunity for a fresh graduate to kick start marketing career and be part of a dynamic team. If you have the enthusiasm, attention to detail, and drive to contribute to our marketing efforts, we encourage you to apply for this Assistant Marketing Executive role.
What we offer:
An opportunity to work with people who are passionate, focused and driven to make a difference
Competitive remuneration and benefits
Training and development opportunities
A culture of teamwork and fun
About Company:
ESD Services Limited is a joint venture between CK Hutchison (formerly Hutchison Whampoa) and Hewlett-Packard which both have been ranked on the Forbes Global 2000 List. We have been recognized as a pioneer in the industry by establishing the world’s first bilingual e-government portal “ESDlife” for Hong Kong government. Today, ESDlife has transitioned and developed into a full-fledged online lifestyle media and e-business company with our flagship brand, ESDlife Wedding, Hong Kong’s most popular wedding planning website. Together with our other brands, such as ESDlife Family and healthyD, we are now one of the largest and most diversified e-business in Hong Kong.
ESDlife is all about people. We not only aim to enrich people’s lives through digital technology, we are also empowered by our amazing team members. Here, you’ll be different because of incredible culture, you’ll be challenged because of valuable opportunities, you’ll be inspired because of brilliant creativeness and you’ll be proud because of being one of us. If you have the spunk and brains to make a difference, come join us now!

Title: Executive Assistant in Faculty of Humanities (Ref: 2400935)
Company: The Education University of Hong Kong
Job Description:
Executive Assistant (Ref: 2400935)
Faculty of Humanities 
The appointee will be responsible for providing a wide range of administrative support to the academic programme development and daily operations, timetabling, handling students' general enquiries and matters, providing support for programme promotion and activities such as Orientation, Information Day, etc., supporting various award schemes, and carrying out general administrative duties as required. The appointee will also be required to work closely with various administrative and academic units in the University and external parties in discharging the responsibilities and performing any other duties as assigned by supervisor(s). The initial appointment will be for a period of 2 years, with the possibility of renewal subject to mutual agreement.
Skills & Requirements:
Applicants should have a recognised Bachelor's degree with at least one year of relevant post-qualification working experience. They should have high proficiency in both English and Chinese (Cantonese and Putonghua) and have good interpersonal, organisational and IT skills. They should also be self-motivated, capable of working independently and multitasking. Experience in programme administration in tertiary education institutions will be an advantage. Immediately available is preferred.
For information on the Faculty of Humanities, please visit: http://www.eduhk.hk/fhm/
Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. 
Initial appointment will be made on a fixed-term contract.  Fringe benefits include the University’s Voluntary Contributions to MPF Scheme or a contract-end lump sum payment (totaling up to 10% of the basic salary), leave, medical and dental benefits.
The University only accepts and considers applications submitted online for this post.  Applicants should complete the online application form and upload a full CV on or before 15 September 2024.  Applications which are incomplete or without the required documents may not be considered.  Personal data provided by applicants will be used for recruitment and other employment-related purposes.  For details of the Personal Information Collection Statement, please refer to http://www.eduhk.hk/jobsopp/index.php?glang=en.
All applications will be treated in strict confidence.  Only those who are shortlisted will be contacted.  The University reserves the right not to fill the position(s) advertised. 
Further information about the University is available at http://www.eduhk.hk. 
EdUHK is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

Title: Management Trainee Programme
Employment Mode: Full Time, Graduate, Job at Greater Bay Area, Management Trainee
Job Description:
Hang Seng Bank Management Trainee Programme -
Embark on a transformative journey with us!
Hang Seng is committed to service excellence. Our people are our most important asset and play a vital role in our efforts to continually enhance our performance for customers and provide best-in-class products and services. We seek to attract high-calibre talent by offering a dynamic working environment, good career development opportunities and competitive compensation packages. We will prepare you to become one of our future leaders.
We have been consistently rated as the ‘Best Domestic Bank in Hong Kong’ for over 20 years*. Our sustained business growth underpinned by our purpose-led strategy and values continues to offer new development opportunities for our people. We invite you to join our Management Trainee Programme offering you a holistic development experience encompassing enterprise-wide development and business/function-specific professional growth.
At the enterprise level, you will immerse in the Bank’s Purpose, Values and business strategies in Fintech, Greater Bay Area development as well as Environment, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives. At the professional level, you will develop core competencies in one of the following seven business / functional streams as our 2025 MT: 
Commercial Banking
Digital Business Services
Functional Services (including Finance or Risk and Compliance) 
Global Banking
Global Markets
Hang Seng Indexes Limited Company
Wealth and Personal Banking
Our programme equips you for the future of banking with tailored job rotations in the first 24 months and a placement which usually lasts up to 12 months. With our learning ecosystem, you will develop core banking and functional competencies; you will acquire most in-demand skills such as Data & Analytics, Growth Mindset, Connectivity and Social Intelligence; take part in Fintech projects and bank-wide initiatives; gain exposures to China and Greater Bay Area development; and receive support to attain your professional qualifications and senior management mentorship.
About Company:
A Career with Hang Seng Bank
Hang Seng is committed to service excellence. Our people are our most important asset and play a vital role in our efforts to continually enhance our performance for customers and provide best-in-class products and services.  We seek to attract high-calibre talent by offering a dynamic working environment, good career development opportunities and competitive compensation packages.
Note:
Visit Hang Seng Career Page and sign up with our Talent Community to receive the latest information about our career opportunities in Hang Seng Hong Kong.
All information provided by applicants will be used only for recruitment purposes and will be used strictly in accordance with the Bank's personal data policies, a copy of which may be obtained by the applicant upon request. Unless otherwise instructed in writing by the applicant concerned, applicants may be considered for other suitable positions within the Bank and its related companies. The personal data of unsuccessful job applicants may be retained for a maximum of two years from the date when the job application is rejected and such data may be retained for a longer period if there is a subsisting reason that obliges the Bank to do so, after which the personal data will be destroyed.
Job Categories:
Banking and Finance Executive
Others
Sales / Account Servicing / Business Development

Title: MPF Specialist
Location: 7/F, Cheung Kei Center Tower A, Hunghom, Kowloon
Job Description:
MPF Specialist of Wealth Management, the candidate is responsible to develop new MPF distribution business for the company through corporate and individual sales channels.
Key Roles and Responsibilities
* Work closely with business development manager, Employee Benefit manager to sign-up MPF scheme from corporate clients
* Meet with client for signing up MPF scheme from individual clients through personal account (PA) consolidation or Employee Choice Arrangement (ECA)
* Conduct outbound call to potential clients and off-site marketing for PA and ECA opportunities
* Achieve assigned sales target, maintain close contact with mapping channels to maximize business opportunities
* Participate in developing creative solutions to solve problems and workflow streamlining
* Ensure compliance with internal and external regulatory requirements at all time

* Competitive remuneration package

* Overseas conventions and exchange program

Qualifications and Skills
* Preferably university graduates
* Sales oriented and positive thinking
* Relevant experience in sales and customer relationship building with a proven track record
* Aggressive and with good communication skills
Education Level (pursuing / obtained): Bachelor, Higher Diploma / Associate Degree, Master / Postgraduate Diploma
About Company:
Having set up our first operations in Hong Kong in 1892, we are one of the established players in the Hong Kong financial services market offering customers a wide array of protection and wealth management products and services.
Our distributors use a multi-distribution approach to serve more than 1,100,000 individuals and corporate customers in Hong Kong.
Our customers expect the highest standards of professionalism from us. To meet this challenge, all our consultants and distributors go through comprehensive training and development programs, and attend regular classes at a dedicated training centre, in order to help customers to build a brighter life.
Our competitive advantage:
We provide a comprehensive range of individual life products, including protection and wealth accumulation products.
We have multi-distribution channels, including agency, brokerage.
The investment funds we offer under the individual unit-linked product and MPF platform have consistently performed well.
We are also an experienced third party administrator in the pensions administration business.
We help individuals and families achieve financial security and obtain more choices by providing them with protection and wealth management products and services through professional distribution channels.

Title: HSBC 2025 Global Banking & Markets Summer Internship Programmes in Hong Kong
Company: The HongKong & Shanghai Banking Corp Limited
Job Description:
Applications are open now for our 2025 Global Banking & Markets Summer Internship Programmes in Hong Kong.
  We are a bank with a strong social conscience and with a size and scale that allows employees to impact important global issues. Working here means powering your personal progression, following your passion and opening opportunities to make positive change.
  Our Internship Programmes are for students in their penultimate year of study and run for 10 weeks. They give you first-hand experience of what it’s like to be part of our team and will prepare you to join our Global Graduate Programme the following year.
  We welcome applications from any degree and from any background. We look for talented people with different experiences and ways of seeing the world. No matter what your academic background, our platform will ensure that you succeed. At HSBC, you can grow personally and professionally. As a trusted, established employer, we will help you navigate your career, develop your skills, and unlock new pathways, all while being rewarded with competitive benefits and flexible work environment.

For:                             Penultimate year students
Duration:                    10 weeks
Areas:                        Global Banking & Markets
Applications open:   8 July 2024
Applications close:   31 October 2024
Start date:                  June 2025 onwards
Location:                   Hong Kong SAR

To read more about each internship programme and to apply, please click on the programmes listed below.

Hong Kong
Global Banking - Corporate and Institutional Banking and Investment Banking Summer Internship
Markets - Sales and Trading Summer Internship
Global Research Summer Internship

We encourage you to apply as soon as possible. We recruit on a rolling basis and may close applications prior to the close date if all positions are filled. In person or Virtual Assessment Centres are planned from September to November.

You can only make one application each recruitment cycle. Candidates should make an informed decision before applying by reviewing the different business areas and location sections on our website.
Application link: https://www.hsbc.com/careers/students-and-graduates/find-a-programme?page=1&take=20&business-area=global-banking-and-markets&location=hong-kong-sar
Skills & Requirements:
Requirements
- Available to work full time for 10 weeks commencing June 2025
- Your graduation date should fall between December 2025 and June 2026
- Obtained, or expected to achieve, a 3.2/4.0 cumulative GPA or equivalent 2.1 degree from a recognised University (as appears on your official University transcript or degree certificate)
- Be fluent in English
- We will consider candidates that require visa sponsorship

To learn about our application and the assessment process, or to discover more about internships at HSBC, please visit hsbc.com/earlycareers.
About Company: HSBC is one of the world’s largest banking and financial services organisations. Our global businesses serve around 42 million customers worldwide through a network that covers 62 countries and territories. Our customers range from individual savers and investors to some of the world’s biggest companies, governments and international organisations. We aim to connect them to opportunities and help them to achieve their ambitions.

About Company:
The Yew Chung Education Foundation (YCEF) is a registered non-profit association in Hong Kong, and the school sponsoring body of Yew Chung International School of Hong Kong (YCIS-Hong Kong) and the Yew Chung College of Early Childhood Education (YCCECE).

YCIS is the first homegrown and original international school in Hong Kong, and YCCECE is Hong Kong’s first specialist institute in early childhood education. With the two networks of schools, the Foundation create a virtuous cycle of quality education in Hong Kong and beyond, beginning with the child in mind.

We are above all committed to equipping students with an inner moral compass, empowering them to take the helm and steer through human complexities with honesty, compassion and confidence. We also strive to further contribute to society by nurturing passionate and innovative early childhood educators at the tertiary level, who can advocate and bring about improvement in the field, giving future generations a strong positive start.

With its sister institutions, YCEF is part of a network of international kindergartens, primary and secondary schools that provides quality education to over 10,000 students, spanning from infancy to tertiary, across 20 locations in Hong Kong, mainland China, Somerset in the UK and Silicon Valley in the US.

For more info about YCEF, please visit our website at: http://www.ycef.com/en/

Title: Case manager
Job Description:
Accomplishes clients’ care by assessing treatment needs; developing, monitoring, and evaluating treatment plans and progress; facilitating interdisciplinary approaches;
Determines clients’ requirements by completing intake interviews; and reviewing therapist evaluations, treatment objectives, and plans.
Establishes treatment programs by setting schedules and routines; coordinating services being provided; arranging resources
Monitors cases by verifying clients’ attendance; observing and evaluating treatments and responses; advocating for needed services and entitlements; obtaining additional resources; intervening in crises; and providing personal support.
Maintains clients’ records by reviewing case notes; and logging events and progress.
Communicate clients’ progress by conducting weekly interdisciplinary meetings and evaluations.
Evaluating the application of learning to changes in treatment results.
Prepares reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing treatment and results data and trends; compiling statistics; completing grant and subsidy applications.
Skills & Requirements:
Medical or allied health knowledge (i.e., physiotherapy, nurses, etc.).
Excellent communication skills in both English and Cantonese.
Good interpersonal, negotiation, mediation, and customer service skills.
Flexible, socially confident, and able to work independently
All ad hoc tasks assigned by management
Fields of Study: Sports Science, Health Sciences & Technology, Nursing, Community Health Practice, Health Professions, Medical Sciences, Occupational Therapy, Physical Sciences, Rehabilitation Sciences
Education Level (pursuing / obtained): Bachelor, Master / Postgraduate Diploma, Doctorate or above
About Company: Our client is a cutting-edge health/wellness center where science meets personalized care in Hong Kong's heart. We combine innovative Health Optimization Technologies (HOTs) with effective movement practices to help you reclaim vitality and achieve your unique health goals. Our mission is to empower individuals on their journey to optimal health, whether recovering from health challenges, or proactive health investors who understand the value of early intervention. Our comprehensive suite of tools, including HBOT, Intermittent Hypoxia-Hyperoxia Training (IHHT), PEMP, Cold Laser Cognitive Training, Neuroptimal, Vasper, ARX, and Bioresonance, alongside movement practices like Pilates, Gyrotonic, and Feldenkrais. We’re dedicated to guiding our clients toward a vibrant, joyful life by restoring health and igniting their inner spark.

Title: Digital Marketing Intern
Job Description:
We’re currently seeking a digital marketing intern who can help us to further scale up our digital platform, content marketing, social media, digital marketing and SEO efforts. The candidate should be enthusiastic and passionate about using technology to make legal services more accessible to people. Prior experience is not required, but the candidate must have the dedication to learn and consistently improve throughout the job. The candidate will assist in creating content to educate our members on various topics such as legal issues and co-ordination of different projects.
  You will be working with a lawyer with 20+ years of legal experience and a growth marketer who has experience in various unicorns. You will establish a strong understanding of the legal tech and digital landscape, thereby building a strong foundation for future careers in legal tech and digital startup, particularly relating to search, social media, and other online marketing channels. You will also be encouraged to come up with new marketing initiative to grow our traffic and brand awareness. If you’re hoping to get into a digital and purpose driven career in the future, this is the starting point for you!
Skills & Requirements:
The candidate will be responsible for helping to grow DocPro and AWEsum Care through:
UX and UI improvements
Keyword research & search engine optimization (SEO)
Content creation (article), promotion and advertising (SEM)
In-house social media account management
Industry research and competitor analysis
Develop, manage and iterate on the new customer acquisition strategy
Respond to customers enquiries
Co-ordinate co-operation and sponsorship with large companies
Assist elderly in using AWEsum Care for advance care planning
Links Building
Eligible Candidates
Part time (2 days a week)
Excellent spoken and written English and Chinese
Able to work independently and results-oriented
Fast learners with strong interest in growing a business
Self-motivated, entrepreneurial and hungry for success
Education Level (pursuing / obtained): Bachelor, Master / Postgraduate Diploma, Doctorate or above
About Company:
DocPro is the leading online provider of legal solutions to businesses and individuals. DocPro’s mission is to make legal solutions affordable and accessible to everyone. Currently, DocPro operates a legaltech platform (DocPro.com) by combining legal documentation services with cutting edge technology. DocPro is also developing a Generative AI service (Doclegal.ai).
Since the official launch of DocPro in April 2020, it has grown from zero users to 50,000 users in one year, making DocPro one of the fastest-growing Legaltech companies in the world. DocPro has been selected by Cyberport as part of its incubation program and is currently.
DocPro also operates a social enterprise platform, AWEsum Care (安心三寶) – awesumcare.com, to provide essential Advance Care Planning documents (Will, Advance Directive and Enduring Power of Attorney, together “ACP Documents”) by combining legal documentation services with cutting edge technology.
AWEsum Care’s mission is to provide Accessible and Affordable Advance Care Planning Solutions to Eldery:
Through accessible and easy-to-use technology
Allow users to DIY ACP Documents for free / at low cost
Increase public awareness of the importance of ACP documents
Application Methods: Please address your application to : Kim
Address: Cyberport, Aberdeen
Note:
2 days a week and relevant working experience preferred.

Please send your CV and any previous digital marketing experience, products or links to https://airtable.com/shrbzQxhnLNsA6pbu

Title: Software Engineer Internship - Summer 2025
Job Description:
Hey Future Innovators! Ready to dive into a world where dreaming big is the norm? At Goodnotes, we're all about being visionary, strategic, and totally open to innovation.  Get ready to build great things as we work in service of our users, constantly pushing higher and aiming for greatness. Taking ownership is our jam – make bold decisions, take action, and own it!
And guess what? We win like a sports team!  Trust, collaboration, and empowerment are the rules of the game. Ready to learn and grow at warp speed? We're all in for that too – never stop learning and iterate fast. 
Ready to be part of this? Join our 2025 Summer Internship Program  and elevate your skills, connect with bright minds, and be a part of something big. But here's the secret sauce: share our passion!  Share ideas, bring enthusiasm, and embrace the joy of creating something awesome together. 

Internship start date:
27 May 2025 (Tuesday) or
24 June 2025 (Tuesday)
About the team:
Join a cross-functional product team to build the next features of GoodNotes, the iPad app of the year 2022 used by over 24 million users. You will work closely with Designers, QAs, and DevOps working across the globe, working from our brand new London office, together with amazing mentors to help you kick-start your tech career.
You will
Join one of our product teams: Backend, Front-end (Web) or iOS platforms to plan and deliver end-to-end solutions. You will have domain expertise in key areas but work fluidly across different programming language technologies.
Develop and deploy solutions with a focus on end-user experience, accessibility, high availability, low latency, and scalability.
Work with Product Designers to deliver effective, high-quality user interfaces.
Solve unique, large-scale, highly complex technical problems using modern web technologies
Follow best practices of software engineering to deliver tested, maintainable, and high-quality DRY code
Share knowledge, promote standard methodologies, and collaborate with cross-functional teams
Interview Process
Take-home Assignment: A timed online coding skills test.
Introduction: The Talent Team want to hear more about your background, what you are looking for, and why you’d like to join Goodnotes.
Live coding & Technical interview: A live coding call with one of our engineers. This is where you get to see what it would be like working at Goodnotes as well as the chance to ask any engineering questions you may have
Hiring Manager interview: A call with your hiring manager. This is the person who will be managing you day to day, working on your growth and development with you as well as support you throughout your internship at Goodnotes.
Values interview – Meeting with members of the Goodnotes Team to answer questions relating to take ownership AND build great things
Apply Now!
You'll receive a chance to make a significant contribution to a product people already love.
Our internships are only available for in-office positions but we’ll cover food and transportation.
The internship will be for May/June 2025 and last 12 weeks
Skills & Requirements:
What you need to be successful
Penultimate or final year student in a related field
Passionate in software development. A bonus if you love productivity or education!
Solid fundamentals of computer science and good problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in one modern programming language such as Typescript, Kotlin, Swift etc.
Experience building a website or an App from beginning to launch in personal projects, open source contributions or previous internships
Able to communicate clearly about your work and proactively reach out when you need help
Fields of Study: Computer & Information Sciences, Computer Science & Engineering, Computing, Computing & Software Technologies
About Company:
Goodnotes is the leading AI digital paper used by millions of users worldwide. Launched in 2011, Goodnotes started as an improvement to physical paper notes — introducing the ability to take handwritten digital notes, search handwritten text, and organize everything into a digital library. Today, Goodnotes is pioneering generative AI for digital handwriting in the productivity space. Goodnotes was most recently named Apple's 2022 iPad App of the Year.
‍Mission
Goodnotes aims to make study and work more efficient and enjoyable. We are a team of learning enthusiasts and technologists who are passionate about activating the next generation of great thinkers.
Note: Please submit your application via https://grnh.se/b4bf209d4us
